Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: marcela s
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Tom Tom Suites. Besides having a beautiful spacious room, the staff made us feel at home. They arranged for a wonderful nanny for our 6 month old baby and even had a baby bed handy! Anything we needed, they were able to deliver with a smile. Also the neighborhood was lovely. We found galleries, cafes, restaurants and antique shops off the tourist path.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna P
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed my stay at Tomtom suites in Istanbul. Its a bit hard to find and allthough in a busy neighbourhood in a calm and peacefull street. Nice rooms, good breakfast, friendly staff. Especially Nural from the front desk was of great help, extremly friendly and very obliging. You will enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “A real delight in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sarah444OR
Reviews.Content: Tomtom Suites is the perfect hotel for those who want a lovely and very convenient place to stay within walking distance to main points of interest. Situated on a street with no traffic makes it even better. The management is helpful and extremely efficient in everyway and the rooms are spacious ,well designed and well decorated. I would no doubt recommend the Tomtom Suites for an unforgettable trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kapelki2
Reviews.Content: I have made 20+ trips to Istanbul, both on business and pleasure, and have stayed in a number of nice hotels in the Sultanahmet, Bosphorus, Beyoglu and airport area. TomTom has been my hotel of choice on at least six occasions so far, and remains my preferred location to stay while on short trips in Istanbul. The location is ideal, just a short walk away from all the shopping and restaurants and the hotel itself is located on a street that is quiet and even guarded (as it is on the same street as the Italian Consulate). The rooms at TomTom are stylish, spacious and impeccably clean. The bathrooms are especially welcoming, with luxurious fittings and top-notch toiletries. The beds are heavenly and there is a free wireless internet in all the rooms. However, it is the service that makes TomTom such a lovely place to stay. Being a small boutique hotel, they offer a great level of attention and hospitality to every guest. Especially Nural is always so welcoming and has an infectious enthusiasm and smile for all TomTom customers. Our use of room service has always been good. The breakfast is both fresh and plentiful, especially as you can order your favoured egg dishes Ã  la carte. The view from the breakfast room on the top floor terrace is pleasant and you can enjoy nice cocktails (not cheap!) or dinner there in the evenings at well. A taxi ride from the airport to TomTom has cost us approximately 50 Liras on a consistent basis. I would highly recommend Tom-Tom for any stay in Istanbul, whether for a weekend break or a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil haven and home from home”
Reviews.Author: KayMallorca
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed 4 nights at tomtom suites and it was truly a home from home. Situated in a very quiet street yet only minutes from the tram station that could take you to any of the major attractions. Beautiful decor, the comfiest bed I have ever slept on and beautiful crisp linens and soft towels. The standard of cleanliness and Maintainance were excellent. The restaurant which was also the breakfast room on the top floor offered amazing views over the Golden Horn and Topkapi. Breakfast was always fresh and lovely although maybe a few changes would be good. If you were here for 7 days it may get a little boring. The restaurant which we ate in one evening was lovely with tastes and textures I have never had anywhere else. Nural the Guest Relations Manager was fantastic, always smiling and happy to help and offer genuine, sincere advice about restaurants in the area, places to visit or provide us with umbrellas when it rained! Would highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back to istambul where I shall definitely stay at Tomtom Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Close to Taksim/Tunel”
Reviews.Author: jennifernycity
Reviews.Content: The hotel's great qualities have been well-documented in previous reviews. I'll just add some additional comments to the mix. My husband and I stayed here for six nights in early March. I loved the room's minimalist decor, with wooden furniture and floors offset by Ottoman accents. The heated tile floors in the bathroom were a welcome feature after long days exploring in the chilly rain. Good water pressure from the shower (an important detail for us). The Wi-Fi was free and fast, a rarity in most hotels. The Turkish delights at turndown were delish. Our rate included a free airport transfer -- which was a breeze from start to finish -- as well as free breakfast and dinner at the rooftop restaurant. The breakfast offerings were basic, with solid service and stunning views across the Golden Horn. The dinner was enjoyable -- a modern twist on traditional Ottoman fare -- but portions were on the small side. There have been many opinions about the surrounding neighborhood. The hotel may seem off the beaten path, but it's only 5 minutes downhill to a nearby tram stop (Tophane). And Istikal, the major pedestrian boulevard, is 5-10 minutes the other direction -- albeit up a steep hill. But hills are just the reality on this side of the Horn. If you're staying for only a few days in Istanbul, you might be better served with a hotel near the historic sights. But we spent the majority of our trip in Beyoglu, which offered more in terms of great restaurants, bars and shopping. It's easy enough to zip over to Topkapi and Hagia Sophia on the nearby tram. (We even took the tram to the airport at the end of our journey -- a straightforward process.) We both agreed that it was one of the best hotels we've stayed in during our travels. For a drink near the hotel, I'd recommend the Solera Winery, which offered a wide selection of local wines by the glass. We found ourselves there on more than one occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Horst R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights at TomTom and we enjoyed the hotel to the full. The hotel is beautiful, perfectly located in a quiet street and only a few steps to go to Istiklal Caddesi or the tram station Tophane to reach the main sites. Furnishing, decors and the bathroom luxurious and spacy. Great service, the staff very attentive and helpful; especially Nural with his tips and restaurant recommendations. Breakfast or dinner on the rooftop terrace with her great views is overwhelming. The hotel is an excellent recommendation for every sort of trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonASwitzerland
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for 4 nights at TomTom and definitely recommend the hotel to people looking for small luxury personalized hotels with lots of charm! The hotel is located on a quiet street in the beyoglu area - a few steps away from Istiklal or from the tram station to go to the main sites. Staff is very helpful and very friendly. Room was amazing (we had a superior suite located on the third floor), very large and nicely decorated + beautiful wooden floor. Breakfast on top floor with great view and rather small but tasteful buffet. We didn't try the restaurant. All in all an amazing hotel - we'll definitely go back there next time we are in Istanbul. Congrats to the Tomtom team!

Reviews.Title: “Detail-oriented service, prime location with an understated elegance”
Reviews.Author: YSzeto
Reviews.Content: We loved the attentive details that made this hotel outstanding. The decor was classy but subtle and the suite we stayed in was spacious with a high ceiling and large windows. We especially appreciate the bathroom with the heated tiles and Molton Brown amenities. The rooftop terrace is quiet with great views - perfect for a relaxing drink before dinner! The hotel is located on a quiet street next to a number of embassies, but at the same time, it is only a three-minute walk from the main pedestrian street. The staff was attentive and accommodating to our needs. Not only were we greeted with familiarity, suggestions to restaurants and tourist sites and maps with transport recommendations were given before we asked for them. We will definitely stay at Tomtom suites again and highly recommend this to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT hotel, awesome staff- made our stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie H
Reviews.Content: We came to Istanbul to celebrate my best friend's upcoming wedding so it was really a special weekend and we wanted everything to be perfect.Tomtom was recommended by a friend who has work colleagues in Turkey. Before I even arrived I was so impressed with the staff (especially Nural at the front desk!) who were incredibly attentive to all my questions and needs. They made us several dinner reservations and answered all sorts of questions about what was best to do and when, where to shop, etc. They also arranged for special surprises for my best friend (champagne, flowers, cards). Once at the hotel I was completely in love- the suite we were in was INCREDIBLE, with beautiful views and very comfortable beds- perfect for lounging and hanging out before going out to dinner. The breakfasts in the morning were also complimentary and kept us full all day as we ran around the city. It was a perfect weekend, largely in part to Tomtom- I recommend this hotel very highly and will definitely stay here on my next (and every!!) trip to Istanbul... My friends and I are well-travelled and agreed that this is one of the best hotels we've stayed at IN THE WORLD. If you're questioning where to stay, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Exceed All Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Dibbis
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is great, but combined with a stay at this magnificent hotel = Absolutely Brilliant! We stayed 7 nights, and enjoyed every minute of it despite the crappy weather. Not only did we receive daily recommendations of restaurants and itinerary suggestions, the General Manager - Ali Dogan Ã‡AMAK helped us with getting great tickets to see a sold out match: Galatasaray vs. Besiktas. Coupled with the very helpful, friendly and professional Nural Inciler at the front desk, our stay exceeded all expectations. We visited a number of the hotels which we had considered prior to settling for the TomTom Suites, and we are happy to report that none of them measured up, especially Photos Vs. Reality ;). TomTom Suites exceeded all our expectations! See my other reviews on restaurants - and please try to avoid one of them close to Taksim square. @Nural - your No.10 Football shirt will be arriving when the 2012-3 season begins ;) @Ali - Thanks for all your help, Good luck with the Championship! Our son is the only kid wearing a full Galatasaray sweats at hockey training ;)

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Daniela981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tomtom Suites for three nights for a special occasionâ€¦and it was wonderful. Our room was very large, king bedded and with a large bathroom with both shower and Jacuzzi. The hotel is five-ten minutes walk from the main attractions, however is astonishingly quiet. Nural at the Front Desk was outstandingly helpful, friendly yet discrete and professional. This was the best hotel we have stayed in and we cannot recommend it highly enough. Thanks Tomtom for the â€œYouniqueâ€� experience!

Reviews.Title: “extraordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Istanbul and, I hope, not my last. There are many reasons for returning to this city, and staying at the TomTom is at the top of the list. The hotel is a short walk in one direction from Istiklal Street, which is the main pedestrian shopping and walking street, and a short walk in another direction from the Tophane tram station, from which you can go easily to the major tourist sites in Sultanahmet. The suite was ample in size and tastefully decorated. The marble bathroom's heated floor and jacuzzi were especially welcome on the cold February days when I was there. The friendly and knowledgeable service rocketed this hotel into the stratosphere for me. If there were a way to give the TomTom a rating higher than excellent, I would do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld
Reviews.Content: The building is modern and beautiful. Rooms are so spacious!! And the bathrooms were amazing!! Plenty of space so that it feels like a real luxury get-away. Service was great as well and everyone is so helpful. Little amenities like free bottled water and free wi-fi were nice. Breakfast is good and views are impressive from the dining area. Great location too since it's a 5 minute walk to the tram stop at the bottom of the hill and easy to get to the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to come back and stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Sheepo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, great decor, spacious room and most friendly and professional staff. We had thoroughly enjoyed our 4 nights stay and would not consider to stay at any other hotels for our future stays. The hotel is within walking distance to the "walking street" with tons of shopping, dining opportunities. Some reviews mentioned the taxi cannot stop in front of the hotel but this is not true. Yes, because the hotel is on the same street of the Italy Consultate, there is a "security" bump but even when we came back late at night, there was still guard at the security gate and open up the security bump and let the taxi in. Some taxi drivers may want to drop you off in the beginning of the street (and give the security bump as the excuse) but if you insist, the bump will come down pretty quickly and the driver can drive in. The WiFi signal in the room is strong, the bathroom has heated floor and the mattress / linen are all top class. All these details really added "luxury" to this hotel, we just love it!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight.”
Reviews.Author: LaPadrona
Reviews.Content: Flat tire enroute, vomiting aisle companion and lost baggage, I was sure this trip was doomed...better to turn around and go home. But no! Patience and Fortitude were rewarded in every way once we arrived at the TomTom. Smiles galore, every problem solved, and a huge, seductively simple suite with Molton Brown bath yummies soothed and smoothed each rumpled feather. We had a glorious nest for the next week and enjoyed every moment! The location really is superb. Turn left down the hill to the tram line and whisk into the historic center or turn right, hike up the hill and you're in the center of the Istanbul nightlife universe. Fantastic boites abound near the hotel and the view from the exquisite terrace restaurant is well worth the price! As for the service...they were wonderful. Wonderful! We had one of the best vacations in a very long history of great vacations...and a large part of its success was due to the great staff and fabulous facilities at TomTom Suites!

Reviews.Title: “4 Days In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: PugetSound-2
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel located on a secure street near the Italian Consulate. We stayed in a deluxe suite which was sparkling clean and well appointed. The hotel staff was exceptional, they helped wrap our souvenirs for travel and on the very early morning we left they made us sandwiches to take along for our breakfast. Speaking of breakfast, the hotel breakfast location is stunning with food to match. Happy Travels, A Puget Sound Couple

Reviews.Title: “TomTom Suites is a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: missjuliesandiego
Reviews.Content: We spent a glorious week at the TomTom Suites. Simon - nearly single-handedly took care of every request. We were there in late November at the end of a three week vacation. The hotel is very welcoming - the beds and pillows are wonderful. The bathroom is nearly as large as a small house, with wonderful amenities. It's a GREAT location. If you get to Istanbul, you should really book a room at the TomTom Suites!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet retreat amidst the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Ksenofon
Reviews.Content: Located on a quiet side street in BeyoÄŸlu only a few blocks away from Istiklal Street, Istanbul Modern and the tram to Sultanahmet, Tomtom Suites is a supremely comfortable and peaceful place to stay in Istanbul. The suites are beautifully decorated with warm wood tones and local fabrics and the marble bath room had both a rainwater shower and a jet tub. Room layout was slightly awkward and the bedroom had no TV (which did not really bother us), but apart from these minor issues it wa hard to find any fault with the room. The breakfast was served on the top floor and the restaurant offered sweeping views of Pera and Sultanahmet. Breakfast selection was more than adequate and the quality of the food was excellent. Overall, Tomtom is a very competent and cozy 4-star boutique hotel that we would be happy to return to when coming to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “You Should Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: RPH80
Reviews.Content: Just finished a four-day weekend and TomTom and cannot say enough about how much I enjoyed this hotel. The location is very quiet, despite the fact that it is a short stroll from major shopping and dining areas. It is also a five-minute walk to the tram that will take you across the Bosphorous to the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. The rooms are very nice and reasonably priced. The hotel also threw in a free meal at the in-house restaurant and a free airport transfer since we booked online. Ther service was excellent and endlessly accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Karenlovestravelllll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a Western Turkey tour and decided to extend 3 nights in Istanbul. He was pretty adamant on the Four Seasons by the Bosphorus but I suggested trying Tomtom Suites, as it had great reviews on Tripadvisor. While switching Istanbul hotels (can't even remember the name of the prev one we stayed), I got worried when the hotel we were staying at in Istanbul had not heard of Tomtom Suites. Even the taxi driver did not know where this was. Clearly, it wasn't a well-known hotel. But thank God that when we finally arrived, the hotel proved too pretty and chic to resist and my husband was extremely happy about our choice :) Our experience was like the reviews on Tripadvisor... kudos to their Younique Service - pillow menu, staff that knew you by name and preference (breakfast choices), luxe bathroom with a jacuzzi tub, amazing amenities, free room upgrade (we ended staying in the Superior Suite), snug bed (too easy to fall asleep on), huge TV, ipod dock and His and Her bathrobes and slippers. Our favourite was the breakfast at the Terrace overlooking the sea... it's a perfect place to laze the day away. Best of all, the staff at Tomtom respected our privacy while being warm and generous all at the same time. Special mention to Mr Nural who took time to recommend us rooftop bars, restaurants, trip experiences, and did all the day-to-day planning for us. His patience and thorough planning certainly made it so easy to explore Istanbul in an inexpensive but unique way. We highly recommend Tomtom Suites! A true gem in Istanbul! Only wished that we stayed here longer!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PBKucka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tom Tom Suites for 4 nights in July during an extended trip through Turkey. We have visited Istanbul numerous times, and it is easily one of our favorite cities in the world because of its beautiful setting, delicious cuisine, amazingly rich art, history, and architecture. Previously, we have stayed in other hotels, to include both Four Seasons properties, but this time, at the suggestion of our travel agent, we decided to try a smaller hotel with a boutique feel. The Tom Tom is a nice hotel in the stylish Galata District, and we did enjoy our stay there, with a few caveats. The hotelâ€™s location is on the Bosphorus side and it is a little out of the way. This is both good and bad. The good side of the location is that it is relatively close to Istiklal Caddesi (which is open until late into the evenings), the Museum of Modern Art and it is also not too far from a convenient tram stop, which makes it easy to get to all the sites. It is also positioned on the same street as the Italian Embassy, so there is security (literally) on the street itself in the form of an armed guard and a traffic control point. On the down side, this location is not the best in town in terms of neighborhood. It is not a dangerous neighborhood, but it is not going to win any awards for luxury dwellings. It is also smack dab in the center of a very large and steep hill, which although it gives you a superb view of the Bosphorus, it means you have a pretty hefty climb to either get to places you want to go or to get back to the hotel if you are walking. Of note, due to its position, it does take a good 20-30 minutes to get to Old Town where all of the must-see destinations are to include the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Grand Bazaar, the Cistern, etc. We would recommend this neighborhood for people with either more than a few days in Istanbul, or those interested in the various museums this side of the strait. The hotel itself is stylish with a contemporary and modern feel. Good use of color and glass make the hotel feel spacious and open. There is tasteful, local Turkish art and the dÃ©cor is well done. The rooms are equally refined. We had a very comfortable king bed suite with a gigantic floor-to-ceiling marble bathroom that included a double vanity. There was a wonderful couch and table in the adjacent sitting room, which is always helpful in order to spread out your things in the midst of a long trip abroad. The room included wifi and, although it was a bit slow, it was nice to have the feature. The bathroom toiletries and room amenities were very fitting for a hotel of this caliber, and in addition there is a complimentary coffee station with bottled water. We enjoyed the room and had no complaints. The restaurant and breakfast were also very good. We were greeted warmly each morning and asked if we wanted to order an omelet or anything else cooked to order. During breakfast, you are treated to the use of a complimentary iPad with internet access â€“ a nice touch that allows you browse the morning news as you see fit and surf the web to check on your events for the day. The continental buffet was well done with attentive service, and we enjoyed all the food very much. Our single biggest complaint about the hotel was the concierge service. Apparently, the normal concierge was away or had quit orâ€¦ well, weâ€™re not exactly sure what happened to him, but the upshot is that the staff that were available were not very good at providing directions or recommended places to eat. We use concierge services heavily during our stays â€“ especially in Istanbul where you need someone with insider knowledge to give current suggestions, make appointments, and generally be available while you are out and about to make changes, if necessary. Istanbul is a fascinating city and similar to any other town known for its art and entertainment scene, things change quickly enough that guidebooks often aren't up to date, making the trusted concierge our go to person in many situations. The hotel staff did not know enough about the services and restaurants in town and often guided us to questionable areas or restaurants that did not meet our expectations. Generally, we believe good concierge service is absolutely integral to a 5-Star experience, so we deducted a star from the Tom Tom for this shortfall. Other than that one gripe, the Tom Tom is a well-run hotel. We will probably not return to the Tom Tom due to its location (it was nice to stay there once, but we would choose a different part of the city next time), but we do recommend the hotel if you are looking to stay in the part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “"Younique Service"”
Reviews.Author: Cricketnc
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel on Oct. 26. We opted to do the " Younique arrival service " upon arrival at the airport. It was a bit pricy or I had thought. We had traveled for approximately 20 hrs, due to some booking errors. Upon arrival we were greeted at the gangway "yes gangway" by a lovely young lady. We were then whisked away via transport to visa control where the young lady promptly uptained our visa's. She then escorted us through a private entrance to passport control bypassing the very long line. She then led us to our driver who loaded our bags and transported us to the hotel. I would have paid double we were so tired and not sure of what to do or where to go. They made us feel like queens and watched over our personal belongs like it was gold. This is a wonderful service you offer to your guests. Our stay at the hotel was just as pleasant. The staff even let me use the managers computer on a daily basis when I could not access a site on mine. They definatly do all they can to make your sure stay is all that you expect it to be and more. This will be they only hotel I will be considering on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like kings and queens”
Reviews.Author: NeridaT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tom Tom on our honeymoon and we were treated like kings and queens. The attention to detail was outstanding - chocolates on beds, rose petals, small gifts, drinks on arrival, gowns and slippers that were slightly different so we knew whose was whose, and more. The iPod dock was a great touch. The heated marble floor in the bathroom was luxurious, and the buffet breakfast was amongst the best I have ever had. To make breakfast even more amazing, they offered iPads! Another special feature of the hotel was the library that held a good collection of DVDs and books for borrowing. All staff were extremely helpful and courteous and helped to create the best hotel experience I've ever had! What a memorable honeymoon. Thank you Tom Tom!

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mhh49
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel was recommended by a friend and I can't say enough about how wonderful our stay was. The service was excellent and the room and bathroom were spacious and luxurious. The location was absolutely ideal. Would not stay anywhere else on my next trip to Istanbul. It's tucked away on a quiet street across from the Italian Embassy but an easy walk to great shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye002
Reviews.Content: This was out first trip to Istanbul, and our stay at the Tomtom Suites was outstanding. The very clean and large suites are very contemporary with hardwood floors and furnishings and lots of high tech stuff (Wi-Fi, flat-screen TV, DVD player, cordless phone, electronic safe). The bathroom was white marble and glass enclosed shower. The service staff was very engaging an helpful. We enjoyed the location close to Istiklal Caddesi (a busy stretch of bars, clubs and restaurants, though the hotel was quite peaceful) but the TomTom is not within walking distance from the sights in Sultan Ahmet but its only a short walk to the Tunel. Overall it was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “great smaller 4/5 star option hotel”
Reviews.Author: mountaintop
Reviews.Content: I'll address the hotel itself as the location comments are spot-on. Room had very comfortable bed; master bath in bedroom has glass walled partition...will have to ask your partner to leave the room for privacy when in use. This top floor suite has a separate living area with powder room, small sink/bar/coffee/mini fridge area...needed more lighting for reading here. Also, has a great balcony/terrace area. Had dinner here twice...great food, and dining staff...concierge folks were just ok. Very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kscott_1002
Reviews.Content: Tomtom service is spectacular. The location is ideal for exploration and evening activities as well. Views from rooftop bar/breakfast room are great. Ipads are available at breakfast and a really thoughtful touch. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marina94122
Reviews.Content: Our trip would not have been the same had we stayed in another hotel. It was so luxurious and such a treat to return to the beautiful and comfortable room we had. It was a quiet retreat in a city that never sleeps! The staff was exceptional and we felt at home with their hospitality. I will recommend the TomTom to visitors - and hope that we can return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for staying in the Beyoglu - exceptional rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Quorta
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 day stay at the Tomtom and would highly recommend it. It is difficult for cab drivers to find so if you can prearrange transport from the airport and back you will find that easier than a taxi (we used Reliable Airport Transfer who were very good). The standard rooms are more like deluxe rooms - they are very spacious and well set out with excellent amenities. The location is very quiet for sleeping and the beds are of the best you will find in a hotel. In a nutshell extremely comfortable. The walk to and from the hotel to nearby places is very steep but don't let that put you off - there are lot's of good shops and restaurants nearby (we loved the restaurant 5.Kat for one of the best views of the city and a very cool dining room - food not so great so suggest shared tasting plates and some nice wine and take in the gorgeous setting). The Pera Palace hotel (where Agatha Chrisie stayed) is also close and a top place for a drink or dinner. Overall the Tomtom staff were very helpful in directing us to all the places we wanted to go..would not want to stay anywhere else in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Happening area, great rooms, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mobida
Reviews.Content: We stayed there by accident but it was a very good surprise. The neighbourhood is a new happening area and has a very energetic atmosphere. Even though it is not the usual location, we liked it there. With regards to the hotel, it is very new, beautifully redesigned and very well decorated. People who like modern hotels will not be diasappointed. We liked the size of the room and their comfort. The personal is very friendly but you need a little of patience because communicating is not always easy if you do not speak Turkish.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Welcomkerry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are from Los Angeles and stay mostly in 5 star hotels when we travel. All the well known hotels in Istanbul were sold out,, and we were not expecting much from the TomTom Suites, which our travel agent had not even heard of. Suffice to say we were pleasantly surprised, and had an absolutely wonderful 4 night stay. Our room was huge (800 sq ft) and very modern. The restaurant was fabulous, and the staff could not have been more professional or helpful. And the location was absolutely perfect-- 5 minutes from Istiklal Street, which is Turkey's best shopping/walk street, and a 15 min walk from the Blue Mosque and other tourist attractions. And the hotel could not have been quieter, thanks to its location on an alley that also has the Italian Consulate. The alley is guarded and gated, so no riff-raff or noise in front of the hotel. Next time we are in Istanbul we will absolutely stay at TomTom again!

Reviews.Title: “cute but not for the 5 star crowd”
Reviews.Author: LVGlobalNomad
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was nicely done, but a bit too trendy while sacrificing the functional element (the glass shower door did nothing to stop the water from getting all over). The service was pleasant but ineffective (our room service orders were never right). Walking about from the hotel is not for the faint of heart, one of the exits was super steep, and since the hotel is right next to a school, the sounds of children running about and being boisterous were prevalent. I can understand why the hotel has good reviews, but it is definitely not for those travelers who are particular.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: harrodsfan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for one night and we had a delightful experience. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty by hotel staff member Asley. She was one of the best, most charming staff we have ever encountered. Friendly and helpful throughout our stay. This boutique hotel has a modern yet very warm decor with fascinating art in the lobby. Our room was spacious and well appointed with a fabulous bathroom including a rain shower and lustrous soaking tub, The rooftop restaurant had a wonderful view and served a delicious buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, poor restaurant”
Reviews.Author: b d
Reviews.Content: The room was very large and the bathroom was extremely chique and modern. There is a large bathtub and a shower cabin in the bathroom. It was the best and the most comfortable hotel room I have ever stayed in. However, the prices of the rooftop restaurant is way too high compared to what they offer for dinner. The meals were over-priced and lacked a satisfactory presentation and taste. It felt as if they were trying to take advantage of the few tourists who choose to dine there because they did not know the city well. I would not suggest you to go there for dinner, you can find many other better priced and more satisfactory restaurants in the area which provide the same pretty view of Istanbul. As for the hotel and the rooms, I do not have a single complaint. I loved it. The decoration, the amenities, the cleanness of the whole place, the comfort of the beds and the overall luxury in the room was what I loved about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique”
Reviews.Author: GilbertoAndJorge
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully refurbished monastery, very large rooms (enough room for a few bowling lanes), equally large bathrooms, high ceilings, and well crafted modern furnishing. We wanted to move in to our suite. Breakfast was served on the top floor semi-open terrace with views towards the Bosphorus. The neighbourhood is quiet, and home to some great rooftop bars and restaurants. It has a slightly off centre location that might worry the less adventurous (took our cab driver a while to find it); but once you're heading in the right direction, the main drag that is Istiklal Caddesi is a 5 minute walk away (fairly steep). A short walk downhill you'll find the tram system that connects you to Sultanahmet across the horn within minutes. Generally the concierge and service was good and not overbearing. While we there, all but one of the rooms were occupied, but it felt like we were two of only a handful of guests and never needed to wait behind anyone for a breakfast table or a taxi. Just one element let the experience down; and we'd suggest you think twice about the tours they promote - we wouldn't normally go with hotel promoted tours/products, but our earlier experience in Urgup was so good, we went for it. We went on the guided walking tour, spice markets, inclusive of a trip on the public ferry, which we could have easily done ourselves for a 5% of their price. The guide's input was minimal, and he disappeared five minutes after boarding the ferry. Â Thankfully we were able to cancel the other tours we'd booked, but the disingenuous aspect was disappointing and a real contrast to our other experiences in Turkey - at the very least Tomtom should vett any other groups it intends to work with or promote. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: holmenhv
Reviews.Content: After looking at a myriad of hotel options, my wife and I stayed at Tomtom Suites for our honeymoon. The stay was perfect in every respect. The check in staff and process was excellent - within seconds of our transport pulling up to the hotel, we were in our room. The premier suite was excellent, the highlight being the luxurious bathroom which was opulent and fitted with great accessories, which my wife loved! The bed and other facilities were excellent. It was fantastic waking up every morning to the lovely view from the room and then go upstairs for the breakfast. We typically came back to the hotel in the late afternoon which was an oasis to escape the hectic streets of Istanbul. As an independent traveller, I did not need to call on the staff for much assistance, but when I needed something, they offered very good advice and recommended places to go with a local flavour. As well as the roof terrace, I loved the room with the library which featured a good display of books on the region. The free use of iPads on the roof terrace was a nice touch. I will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: Julandkate
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is extremely charming. Very well located, although most taxis do not know it and do not know how to reach it ( we advise you to always carry a map and the hotels phone number). The breakfast is delicious, great selection of turkish cheeses! Staff is nice and helpful. This hotel is clearly a much better choice than large five star chain hotels in istanbul ( having experienced the swissotel).

Reviews.Title: “A cool oasis in a bustling city”
Reviews.Author: QuincyYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tomtom Suites for four nights at the end of August. Do not be put off by the streets approaching the hotel as the it bears no resemblance to the surroundings! It is cool (in every sense), has huge rooms, pleasant staff and surely one of the best views of the city from its terrace on the 5th floor. The breakfasts were very fresh and plentiful. An ideal location, it is a few minutes walk up a (steep) hill to Istiklal, one of the main shopping streets on this side of the city. The main historic part looks faraway but in fact is easily accessible by jumping on a tram, taking a taxi (reasonably priced) or even walking across Galata Bridge in approx. 30 minutes. The hotel also offered a shuttle bus. We visited with our two teenage children so used two rooms which were very spacious and comfortable. Fab artwork too! All in all, highly recommended and would definitely stay again if lucky enough to revisit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and beauty”
Reviews.Author: souha294005
Reviews.Content: Very well located, tom tom suites, a wonderful boutique hotel, is situated in a central and quiet area. All rooms are suites, modern with beautiful furniture and most comfortable beds. The modern art gives a lot of charm to this unique address. The terrace of the hotel is quiet romantic with a view on the bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “it is a secret gem”
Reviews.Author: PETER-GR G
Reviews.Content: Sooo comfortable rooms, so many toiletries and amenities, so nice decoration plus so nice people... try it.-

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels of its type in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Masterpsych
Reviews.Content: Very well run by uniformed, English-speaking staff who were unfailingly polite, helpful and never failed to ask how they can help on all contacts,. The building is a wonder of architecture and was spotlessly clean (it is a converted older build). The bathroom was almost totally marble, with a large Jacuzzi tub, and glass stall shower and lots of room. The bed was great and the amenities were super, although they need to me more generous with bottled water. The hotel building is on a side street with some embassies nearby, a small problem for vehicles (because of the street barrier system associated with such places), but the enhanced police protection was welcome. We were within walking distance of many nice areas, making the evening pleasant to stroll and find restaurants, but the guest should be in fair physical condition to do this because of the hills. The breakfast was great and varied, and served by waiters. The â€œcall to â€œprayer that may wake some people at early hours (sometimes a problem in Islamic countries) was minimal here. The downside was associated with the problems of retrofitting and older building. The bathroom lights were overhead and to the side, making shaving and other tasks unnecessarily difficult, The telephone was not by the bed (for wake-up calls), and not very loud. Thus we would miss them, but the staff would always send up a staff member to knock on the door (I recommend you travel with a portable alarm clock). I would recommend this hotel to any discerning traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Facility and Service. Strange Location”
Reviews.Author: PickyaboutHotels
Reviews.Content: Our deluxe suite room was terrific in all respects. The furnishing and bath were Ritz Carlton/Four Seasons quality, the bed was ultra comfortable and the A/C worked well. The shower stall was large and water flow good. Staff were pleasant and helpful. I personally did not like the location of the hotel. There was nothing of interest within ten minutes. The Isiktali pedestrian street was just ten minutes away but was up a very, very steep hill which my 65 year old body had difficulty handling. The walk back down the hill to the hotel was difficult due to lack of lighing in the alleys. The walk to and from the tram was less taxing but still an annoyance. I found the Istanbul taxi drivers to be among the worst in the world (tied for last with Prague) About 50 % of the Taxis either did not know how to find the hotel or would not take us there. Most of those who would take us refused to go past the consulate barrier. Many of the taxis we took from the hotel to other locations would drop us off blocks from our ultimate destination leaving us to fend for ourselves. Thankfully the Istanbul residents were incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotel can't be held responsible for poor taxi service but the taxi situation contributed significantly to my negative feelings about the hotel's location. Another negative was the lack of a fitness facility.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: fabiobol
Reviews.Content: The TomTom Suites is a completely renovated ex-franciscan house, now a stylish boutique hotel part of the Small Luxury Hotel of the World. We give TomTom the highest marks because of: Location: in the modern side of Istanbul but very close to Galata bridge, therefore very convenient to reach all old town locations (mosques, Topkapi, Gran Bazaar...). 10 minutes by taxi unlike other luxury hotel around Taksim. Nested in a quiet well-guarded street in front of Italian consulate. Room: large, well equipped, modern furniture, wood floor, excellent bed, large marble bathroom. Very impressive by all standards for anyone who likes this style (website is realistic). WiFi working well in the room. Our daughter slept in the same room, quite comfortably, the room size is really large. Service: always up to the expected standard, kind and extremely helpful on hints for visits around the city or booking a nice restaurant in town. Food: breakfast is served next to the lobby, quiet and rich selection of food, iPads available for guests. Small restaurant on the rooftop terrace (4th floor), pleasant setting and good quality food, mix of international and turkish cuisine. We stayed 5 days and have always enjoyed returning to our room after a busy day around Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KeroroGunso
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights in a deluxe suite. Overall, a good option for Istanbul. Wasn't difficult to find at all by giving the website map to the taxi driver. Location is good. Safe. Quiet. Very close but steep walk to Istiklal street. No problem for me but wouldn't necessarily recommend to my parents. Sultanahmet is walkable as is the Galata tower area. Rooms (at least ours) wasn't truly a suite but a good size room with bed, desk, two arm chairs and large couch. Ample storage. Bathroom was nice, marble, no window, separate shower and tub, one sink. Internet is free and relatively fast. Breakfast is very good and staff was very helpful. My one negative was the absence of a close by gym. Decided on Tomtom instead of spending a fair bit more on the Park Hyatt. Overall was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was great but the restaurant superb”
Reviews.Author: tommulligan
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed at the Tom Tom Suites for 4 days. As the taxi approached we were filled with trepidation as the approach was through what appeared to be a very down market district. That concern passed as we realised that the hotel's neighbour was the Italian consulate. We arrived very early but our room was ready in quick order and tea a coffee appeared to help us pass the time. The rooms are of the highest quality and the staff were, to a man, knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. We discovered that the Tom Tom Suites was truly convenient being ten minutes by tram from the main touist spots of istanbul and 5 minutes walk (albeit steep) to the restaurant hub of Beygelou. The great surprise was the quality of the roof top restaurant and bar. We dined there on our first evening and it was truly superb. In fact so good that we returned for our last evening meal. Even if you don't stay at the Tom Tom Suites I can truly recommend the restaurant to any one in need of good food while in Istanbul. Tom Mulligan

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in fun neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: AlexinSF
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Tom Tom Suites -- the hotel is modern and beautiful and historic all at once, just like Istanbul -- a completely remodeled nunnery with spacious, comfortable suites and an art gallery inside. The rooms, the breakfast, the staff were all wonderful. The location is fantastic -- in the heart ofthe city, away from the tourist hordes in the old town and in an affluent, hip part of Istanbul a half block away from a 2 mile long pedestrian-only thorough fare with every type of restaurant, cafe, ice cream parlor and art gallery imaginable. We walked there almost every night and felt like we were part of the thriving young professional political Istanbul scene. The tram is two blocks away and we took it daily to museums, the river, and the markets, always happy to arrive back at the refreshing, comfortable and welcoming Tom Tom Suites. Yes the walk to the pedestrian thorough fare is up a steep hill but it is quite short and good for the legs and appetite. If you cannot make it then you can take a slightly longer route via trolley. We found the location to be fantastic and the beuaty, comfort and service to be exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish delight”
Reviews.Author: pocanhontas
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed a week in the hotel and it was amazing. The room was very well decorated, comfortable and clean. The bed and the pillows were between the best I've slept in a hotel. The bathtub was my salvation in the end of a day walking. The products in the bathroom are all from Molton Brown! The staff was always very attentive and friendly and the breakfast was delicious! They lend you an IPAD, during the breakfast if you want to check the news or your email. The location is also good, a small calm and safe street. But be prepared to walk, because it is in the almost in the top of a hill.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: tinaland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a gem! The best ambience and best service, combined with a gratis breakfast. I truly doubt the highly touted (and very expensive) well-known hotels in Istanbul would come close. Location-wise, as long as you don't mind walking up a steep hill, the Istiklal Ave with all of its restaurants, bars and great people watching, is moments away. Also, we found the site "walkable" to the old city, or the streetcar makes sight-seeing quite easy. I hate to give away secrets, but this hotel deserves to succeed.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid60
Reviews.Content: Tomtom Suites exceeded our expectations. We were impressed with size and appearance of the suites, the service, the quality of the food, the location, the comfort of the furnishings, the cleanliness, and the peace and quiet we experienced after long days of touring Istanbul. The hotel is located on a restricted access street, which means that it is excedingly quiet. Tomtom Suites is the nicest hotel we've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: cellapink
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two sisters recently spent 5 nights at Tomtom Suites. Overall, we liked the hotel, but found that service was not up to the standard that one would expect from a small, boutique hotel. The staff was overall polite and friendly, but just didn't go above and beyond to make our stay there memorable. Then, we had an incident on check-out that was very troubling and left us with a negative view of the hotel and management. First the positives: Tomtom is a very nice property with well-appointed suites and fabulous baths. We have traveled quite a bit throughout Europe, and the breakfast was one of the best we've had in terms of the quality and selection of items. The rooftop lounge is a great way to relax after a hectic day. We also enjoyed the location very much. Although it is a distance from the tourist sights, we enjoyed the liveliness and character of the neighborhood and the proximity to the trendy restaurants. If you stay at Tomtom, do dine at Cezayir. We also had a nice time at 360 Istanbul. Negatives: As mentioned previously, the service was just okay. Our trip began inauspiciously with a major flight problem with United airlines. Our flight out of Chicago was delayed due to mechanical problem. While the mechanics worked on the plane, the United computer system crashed world-wide, grounding all international flights. Then it was impossible to get re-booked in a timely manner. We were lucky to get out just a day and half late on Turkish airlines, however our luggage was not re-routed as promised and we went for days in Istanbul without our luggage. Obviously, we arrived at the hotel a day later than planned. We had notified the hotel that our flight was canceled and that we would be arriving a day late. Our sisters had been scheduled to arrive the day after we had planned to arrive. When we arrived at the hotel, we were not offered any assistance in terms of the lost luggage. We had reported the luggage as lost upon arrival and were told to call back the next day. We suggested that the hotel might call for us, given there was a significant language barrier when trying to communicate with Turkish airlines, and the staff reluctantly agreed. Our luggage finally arrived (mine on the third day, my husband's on the fourth day). The hotel did offer us a complimentary bottle of champagne for our trouble, which was most appreciated. Then, upon checkout with a taxi waiting to take us to the airport, we had a major issue. We were charged for the first night when our flight was canceled, as we expected, per hotel policy. However, the hotel insisted that our sisters also arrived a day late. I explained that the sisters had always been scheduled to arrive a day later than us. Even when we were able to pull up an email I had sent to them on the Tomtom's own computer clearly stating the arrival and departure dates for both of our suites, the hotel insisted this was incorrect!!!!!! I had received an email response from Tomtom confirming the correct dates a few days before we left, but unfortunately had not printed it. The hotel could not locate that email confirmation. It took us 30 minutes to check out and ultimately the gentleman at the desk called someone and got approval to drop the extra night from our sister's bill. We had a flight to catch and the whole thing was most disturbing. When I got back to the states, I located the email confirmation from theTomtom and sent it to the hotel indicating how distressing it was to have had to go through an argument when the hotel had clearly confirmed our dates. I did receive an apology from the hotel manager. The fact that the gentleman on check out would not honor the dates in the email from me that he could see in his computer before his very eyes is appalling to me. Why he spent 30 minutes before he called someone is also surprising, when he knew we had a flight to catch. The other negative, although minor, is the morning noise from the school children coming to school in the courtyard. Our room looked down on the courtyard of the hotel entrance and we were awakened each morning between 7:30 and 8:00 by the high-pitched laughter and screaming of elementary school children coming to school. The noise really carries in the courtyard. Not a big deal, unless you like to sleep in. If so, you may want a room that does not look onto the courtyard. Overall, I don't think I would stay there again, given all the options in Istanbul, unless I was certain that Tomtom had raised the bar in terms of service.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld032
Reviews.Content: A small inn, and definitely hard to find, this place is a gem. If you are considering the Four Seasons or Ciragan but you want a more intimate Istanbul experience, you will love this place. Splurge for the loft; the deck alone is worth the price. Overlooking the Marmara Sea, with views of Sultanahmet, it's actually bigger than the suite itself. The service is helpful but not suffocating, and the breakfast is delicious traditional Turkish. I used to live in Istanbul, and even I had a hard time finding this place. Bring the directions with you and print out a map for your taxi driver. Eventually, the taxi can find the Italian Consulate (if you know the words in Turkish). A small price to pay for being out of the way. Free wifi also a bonus! Several people have complained about the hills - you are in Istanbul - no getting around it. You want the views, you have the hills. I also heard complaints about the school children, which really made us nervous. We were not bothered by them, but we left pretty early each morning. I highly recommend this place. It exceeded our expectations in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzyNewtown
Reviews.Content: We loved Tomtom! The interior decorating is fresh and modern. Original art is everywhere - paintings, sculptures, ceramics. Our room was very large and comfortable. The bathroom had marble everywhere, very clean. There was a shower and bathtub - all the fixtures were "high end". The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast restaurant served a terrific buffet breakfast, Turkish/Euro-style, quite lovely and delicious. The rooftop fine dining restaurant served very interesting artistic meals with a good view of Istanbul. All the service, from the front desk to both restaurants, was first class. The staff was friendly, helpful, and professional. We did not speak Turkish, so we appreciated the staff's excellent command of English. The location was a short walk to the main shopping and dining part of Taksim. We felt safe taking that walk in the evening, though we probably would have felt less comfortable if we had been walking alone. The neighborhood is not bad, it is just empty at night because it is more residential than commercial. We saw this as a positive thing because the neighborhood is quiet, unlike noisy Taksim just a few blocks away. In the mornings as we ate breakfast, we looked out the windows and saw many local children walking up the hill to school, accompanied by their parents. After each day of sightseeing, we wandered around Taksim and found enjoyable restaurants and shops. Our accommodations at Tomtom had only one drawback - the only place to store clothes was in one closet that also had a few shelves. There was no piece of furniture with drawers. If a guest were only staying for one or two nights there would be no problem, We had been travelling for 10 days and had a lot of clothes with us. We kept our clothes in our suitcases. The storage situation was not a big issue for us because everything else was so nice. The closet area also included a safe and a refrigerator. Every evening the staff brought us lovely little Turkish candies, and bottled water was provided in the room, free of charge. The great service, beautiful accommodations, fine food, and good location all lead us to highly recommend Tomtom.

Reviews.Title: “Every City deserves a Tomtom - Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: mistermonsieur
Reviews.Content: The rooms are generous in space and equipped with everything you might need. More than the obvious comfort and style of the hotel I'd like to mention some small details that make me wish for a Tomtom in other cities: - excellent light concept - discrete, yet highly pleasant room refresheners in the whole hotel - umbrellas, sightseeing maps and other things are provided with a kind "of course" Staff did an excellent balanace between being truly interested in the guest's needs, offering help and advice while maintaining a professional and respectful attitude. I'd like to thank at this point once more the whole reception staff and Fuad - his breakfast was the best start in the day I could imagine, and the food was fresh and delicious. I wasn't very satisfied with is the small selection of room service items that are avaible during the night and would welcome a wider choice of food in the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: parksideMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel were very helpful leading up to the stay, but we found the service once we arrived fairly average. Reception staff were somber and unhelpful. The base room had views of the brick wall next door. The area around the hotel is run down and without character. The breakfast was excellent and the staff here friendly.

Reviews.Title: “excellent good, great views!”
Reviews.Author: goworldmtl
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at this hotel but had read that the rooftop restaurant was good and had a breathtaking view. It was true! The meal was delicious and the view was absolutely fantastic. The restaurant was empty so I had my choice of tables and chose the one with the best view on Topkape, St-Sophie, the Blue Mosque, the Bosphorus and the Sea of Marmara. And it was sunset time, what more can you ask for? You should definitely go there for a meal. The streets are pretty quiet around this hotel and it might scare someone but really, it's not dangerous at all even if you're alone like I was. Definitely a place that you should put on your list for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good one”
Reviews.Author: KennyAstana
Reviews.Content: Service location and rooms are great. Good place for small trips

Reviews.Title: “belissima panaroma”
Reviews.Author: ophelia5
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 4 days in this gorgeous hotel for our visit to Istanbul. people were very kind, the food was soo delicious, the rooms were so clean, the service was outstanding but the most attractive thing was the panaroma of the hotel. It made meÃ¬stay there more but unfortunately we have to come back :/ Grazie per tutti..

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull little GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: tekinGL
Reviews.Content: our stay at tomtom suites was wonderfull, we stayed there just 5 nights but we sure we want come back. we know istanbul very well, every year in may we visite istanbul, so tomtom suites where the best hotel we have tried in istanbul. very close to the shopping street "istiklal cad." and also a short walk down to the "modern art museum" or "eminÃ¶nÃ¼". a big thank you to the staff. they where so nice and friendly. see you soon... tekin& martina

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel with attention to little details”
Reviews.Author: MucDubai
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed. It is a nice boutique hotel with friendly staff and attentention to the little, but important details! The hotel is located close to one of the main pedestrian streets in Istanbul with plenty of shops and restaurants around. Transportation (taxi and tram) are just a few minutes away. The size of a standard suite is sufficient and the interior is very high quality. Ipod docking station is available in the room. The free ipdas make it easy to quickly browse the net while having breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayo Gal
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at Tomtom Suites at the end of our Turkish vacation, and after having spent 5 days in Sirkeci prior to traveling in the country at the beginning of our trip. We enjoyed the Tomtom very much; our room was spacious and comfortable and we loved the bathroom. Breakfast was very nice with a good choice of food and cooked eggs, and the breakfast staff were friendly and they remembered preferences. We had a wonderful dinner in the roof top restaurant, La Mouette. While expensive, the French/Turkish fusion food was delicious. We enjoyed seeing this side of Istanbul, across the Golden Horn, but, as tourists, we preferred being closer to all the sites in Sultanahmet. While it is easy to take the tram or walk, we were happy to have seen and experienced the old city from a base closer to the major points of interest. We are 60++ and really like to walk. In fact we walked from Tomtom to Sultanahmet to visit the Archeology Museum and walked back to the hotel with no difficulty. The one thing we found difficult was the VERY steep hill that you need to walk up to get to Istiklal Cadd. It is not an easy stroll. One day we climbed the hill three times and the last time it was hard to come up with any enthusiam. While we loved the hotel itself, I am not sure we will return

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Will stay here again if I come back to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: aafendy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Sept 2010 for my 1 year anniversary. This was my first time visiting a European country, and I am glad I chose Turkey to be my first stop. Booked this hotel because of the great ratings and comments from trip advisor. Loved the location of the hotel, walking distance to the metro and Istiklal Caddesi where we ate most of the nights and walked around. Beautiful hotel and decor. Spacious room, bathroom, and sitting area. Comfortable bed. Breakfast was included in the rate that we paid, and it was lovely sitting on the roof top every morning with the view. Breakfast included variety of cheeses,meats, breads, muffins, jams and spreads, yogurt, potatoes, vegetables, and you can request to have eggs any way you would like. The only thing I would complain about was the they were doing renovation on the restaurant in the hotel, and right after about 10-11 am or so they would start, and our room was located right underneath. So at times we would go back to room to rest before heading out, and all we would here was banging and tools dropping. I went down to hotel to tell them but they simply said there is nothing they can do. So I was a little disappointed about that, but the pro's outweighed that one con. But LOVED everything else about, and I will def. stay here again if I come back (which I will, loved the shopping there!)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: ReasonLondon
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 11 nights in the hotel and was very well looked after, especially at breakfast and by the maid service in the room. Unlike other reviewers, I wasn't bothered by noise from the school, but I was at the back in room 31. I loved the complimentary Ipads at breakfast - very useful for catching up on emails. The restaurant was excellent and had the best bottle of wine during my entire stay in Istanbul - a sauvignon blanc from NZ. This was a fine dining experience and yes the prices do reflect this. I didn't use room service and so cannot comment, except to say that it did seem a bit limited. As the walk up to Istiklal Street is steep, I used to walk down to Tophane and catch the tram to Kabatas and then get the funicular to Taksim, or I'd get the tram over to Sultanahmet etc. for sightseeing, thus avoiding the steep walk uphill. Downhill wasn't nearly so painful!

Reviews.Title: “Super location,super staff.”
Reviews.Author: GregW172
Reviews.Content: Located just far enough away from Istiklal to be quiet and just close enough to make walking anywhere easy. The staff, especially Asli Yurdakul and Fuat Tiryaki (sp?), were very pleasant and helpful. The library had more relevant materials than one could digest in five stays. The restaurant on the fourth floor has a great view and very good food but, due to the secure nature of the location, is not crowded. We were able to have a lovely dinner for eleven on the balcony with a smashing view of the Bosphorous and Sultanahmet area. At breakfast the complementary access to the electronic tablets made checking e-mails and websites for local attractions a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Best overall hotel experience in my 35 years of travelling!”
Reviews.Author: Balzac51
Reviews.Content: At first I was hesitant in staying anywhere other than The Ciragan Palace hotel where I had stayed several years ago but due to current outrageous prices and distance from the old town I started searching for a new hotel and came across Tomtom suites and what a find it was. From the moment we checked in, Ferhat at the reception desk with his professional demeanor made us feel comfortable and at home. In the room there was a typed welcome letter in our native language prepared by Sinan's(night receptionist) mother who was also of our ethnic origin. My cousin and I were blown away by this gesture. Fuat at the breakfast room greeted us every morning with a big smile catering & anticipating to all our needs. The rooms were spacious, tastefully decorated with very comfortable beds & pillows.The bathrooms were very plush with jacuzzi tubs,marble walls & floors, separate showers & heated floors. The hotel was well located on a quiet and safe street across the Italian consulate.Down the street a short walk away was the tram stop, two stations away from the spice bazaar. To sum it all up, I will never stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ACJI97
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful small boutique hotel. The rooms are so nice. The personnel is gorgeous. It is a quiet place to relax. It has a restaurant on the top terrace where you will find a great view of Istanbul. Definitively I would like to come back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveller323
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a week-long stay at the Tomtom Suites. The hotel and the rooms are beautiful, newly renovated and very large. Our suite included a king size bed, a large living area including a fridge and tea/coffee, very large closets and a spacious bathroom. The heated floors in the bathroom are a great touch! The hotel location is directly next to a school so the children arrive for school between 7-8am and are EXTREMELY noisy so we were woken up daily at 7am by their yelling and the sound of rolling back-packs. The rooms were very warm (the hotel seemed to be kept near 26 celcius!) so we had to sleep with our windows open, making the noise that much worse. The hotel restaurant and room service were also disappointing. The restaurant is extremely expensive by Istanbul standards (we spent nearly $100 USD on only two of us without drinks) and the room service menu is incredibly limited (only sandwiches). Overall, the rooms here are fantastic, the staff was very responsive and we enjoyed our stay but the walk to Istiklal Street was extremely steep and the rooms were noisy. For the money, Tomtom was OK but there are other Istanbul hotels in this range that have more facilities and are less noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, impeccable room, service out of this world”
Reviews.Author: asta9972
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Tomtom Suites, I now know what service is. It's not just a friendly smile or an offer of assistance. It is hotel staff going out of their way to make things easier, agreeing to be flexible about rules, providing service that is specific to the individual, and all in a relaxed, fuss-free manner. We arrived at Attaturk airport at 6am, after which we were transferred to the hotel, checked in to our room immediately without additonal charge or fuss, and shown to a lovely breakfast. I had mentioned that it was my partner's birthday that weekend, and on arriving back to our room after a hard day's sightseeing, we found a bottle of prosecco on ice, with two glasses and a birthday card. We couldn't have been happier. Throughout our stay, the staff were courteous and extremely helpful, but without ever seeming obsequious, false or making a fuss. It was absolutely ideal. Our room also exceeded our expectations - modern, spacious, impeccable, stylish, very clean, and extremely pleasant to relax in after spending all day on our feet. The bathroom was amazing - an enormous free-standing bath, and extensive Molten Brown toiletries throughout. And the bed was absolutely enormous and extremely comfortable. Finally, the hotel was very well located - within walking distance of endless winding streets of bustling restaurants and quirky bars, and neighbouring the Italian Embassy, meaning that the road was largely closed and therefore extremely quiet (despite being so central). Tomtom Suites could not come more highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in Istantul!”
Reviews.Author: SenoritaL
Reviews.Content: (1) Location: Perfect location - just off Istiklal Caddesi, thus away from the noisy main street but close enough to access all the shops and restaurants at any time of the day. It's location right opposite the Italian Consulate means that the small alley where the hotel is located is controlled by security, which adds a feeling of additional safety. The 'Tophane' tram stop is just 10 mins walk down hill. Alternatively, you could walk up to Istiklal Caddesi (2 min via a short cut), where a further 2 mins easy walk will take you to the TÃ¼nel funicular station. The funicular then connects with the Karakoy tram stop. From Tophane tram stop, it's a nice and easy 20 mins journey by tram to Sultanahmet. The area where Tomtom Suites is located is very safe; it's definitely not a "run-down" nor dangerous are. Rather, it has a traditional neighbourhood feel where old residential buildings sit side by side with mosques and local businesses (kebab shops, grocery stores, homeware stores). Never once we felt threatened walking on the surrounding streets at night. (2) Room: Contemporary, stylish, comfortable, and spacious. The design exudes an East-meet-West atmosphere and represents a perfect blend of new and old. High ceiling throughout, which adds a feeling of additional space. We were upgraded to the Superior Suites, which is marvellous. The room has an extra spacious sitting area, an iPod dock, a king size bed, LCD TV, and tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom is huge, with separate shower and hydro-massage bath. It provides much needed relaxation and comfort at the end of a busy day. Great bathroom amenities that include Molton Brown soaps, shampoo, and lotion, as well as toothbrushes, shaving kit, bath salt and loofah. Bathrobes and slippers are also provided. The hotel offers a pillow menu and complimentary bottled water in room. Complimentary wireless internet. The room is so cosy that we find it hard to leave every morning!! (3) Restaurant: The hotel has a breakfast room and a rooftop restaurant. Breakfast was included in the room rate and plentiful. There are different types of cheese and breads, simit, sausage, ham, eggs, cereal, yoghurt, fruits, freshly squeezed juice, and of course, tea and coffee. They even provide iPads for newspaper reading - a great start for the day! We didn't try the rooftop restaurant but the view there is amazing! You could see the Bosphorus and Sultanahmet in distance - a great place to linger! (4) Public areas: The hotel has a library where you could borrow some DVDs and to use the internet and printer. The lobby has a cosy sitting area with some interesting art works and displays. Glass elevator, which is also a nice feature. (5) Service: Excellent staff! Service is very attentive - it was raining one morning and a staff member gently handed over an umbrella as we were about to step out the hotel! Every staff in the hotel is friendly, courteous, pleasant, and warm. They always made us feel very welcome, and no question is ever too much. They are always willing and ready to help - whenever we had a request, they responded to it immediately. Everyone working at Tomtom Suites appears to enjoy their job! The atmosphere is simply fabulous! We thoroughly enjoy the Turkish hospitality of Tomtom Suites!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: JGray_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights last month with my wife and two sons. The hotel is outstanding. The staff was very helpful throughout our stay. Loved the rooftop restaurant. The chef and staff was amazing. Location is great. We are definitely staying there next time we visit the country.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TheWitch_33
Reviews.Content: A brilliant hotel with cozy staff, awesome food in restaurant with a fabulous view to the Bhosphorous, clean rooms and a historical atmosphere what you will experience. It is also located in the hearth of Istanbul where you will feel the beats of brightness. I was there with some collegues and even it was a bussiness trip, I had the possibility to see some must-see places since it was really central. You can leave yourself into the arms of a stunning nightlife if you are in the mood with lots of activities going on just beside. However, if quiescence is what you are looking for, the hotel can also possess your soul in peace. I am sure that you would definitaley be writing a comment like mine just after visiting Tomtom.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most romantic and charming location in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: NinoschkaMar
Reviews.Content: The experience staying at the Tomtom Suites was wonderful. The hospitality and accommodation from the hotel staff was superb. The restaurant, the chef and the staff were professional and welcoming. The presentation of the food was beautifully displayed and tempting to the eyes to eat. The taste of the food at the restaurant was delicious and freshly made. The view from the restaurant is amazing, one can see all of Turkey's history, skyline and diversity. It's so romantic to go with a mate or a partner. I recommend everyone to visit this hotel and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best wiews of the town, in a very convinient location”
Reviews.Author: Moskatel
Reviews.Content: In my personal opinion, this hotel is one of the many hidden gems of Istanbul. Located in an area not very easy to get if you are driving yourself. I would advise taking a taxi to get there. The service from the first "hello" until the last "bye" was impecable. The terrace restaurant wiew is second to none. The food was excellent. The staff was very nice. In short, next time I am going to Isnbul, I dont believe I will stay anywehere else. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel, but with Caveats”
Reviews.Author: London_Guy99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at TomTom Suites at the end of January 2011. Overall, this is a very comfortable, spacious and stylish hotel. Our suite was very clean with little to no wear. Bed was comfortable, although a bit hard for my preference. A selection of bed pillows are provided. The all marble bathroom was gorgeous, complete with a Philippe Starck whirlpool tub, 2 sinks, and a separate shower. Beautiful wood floors, attractive art work, lamps and decorations rounded out the remainder of the suite. Given the above, I can recommend TomTom suites. However, the following should be noted: 1) Hotel is located in the BeyoÄŸlu district of Istanbul. If you are only coming to Istanbul only for a few days, most of the major tourist sites are located on the other side of the Golden Horn (ie - Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace). It would be about a 30 min walk or so. There is a taxi rank just up the street, and a cab ride is less than 10 TL. The problem seems to be getting back as even taxis with meters seem to charge several times as much on the other side of the Golden Horn. Most taxi drivers do not know the city well, and even providing them with a map some dropped us off several blocks from the hotel. 2) The BeyoÄŸlu district is fairly hilly. There is a very steep hill from the Hotel up to the main street. 3) There are few recommended restaurants in the area. If you review the top restaurants in Trip Advisor, they are mostly all located on the other side of the Golden Horn. 4) The Hotel appears to have recently changed their in house restaurant. The "Bistro" as indicated on their website appeared to be all but closed. The Terrace Bar upstairs has been changed to a modern/contemporary restaurant. We ate there once, and the food was decent, but the portions were small. After a long day exploring Istanbul, this wouldn't be my first choice for a filling meal. The Hotel needs a more accessible restaurant. 5) Room service is poor. Menu is extremely limited - caesar salad, hamburgers, and a few other items. We called room service one night and asked what the hamburger came with and was told that it didn't come with anything. When it was delivered, it came with fries. Also, we asked if anything could be ordered that was not on the room service menu - we were told if we wanted something else to come to the restaurant. That would defeat the purpose of room service! Other hotels such as the W will gladly accommodate such requests. 6) Breakfast Buffet is extremely limited. Although they can make eggs, omelets on request, there are no other hot items. Mostly cereal, bread, some cheese and cold cuts. 7) Area directly around hotel is run down. There is an empty lot next door. Next to that there are a series of abandoned buildings, some with collapsed roofs etc. Not sure how safe the area is or not, but the front desk told us not to carry much cash with us when we go out! (although this is sound advice for any large city, it is not exactly reassuring for the hotel to mention this to you as soon as you check in). 8) The street the Hotel is on is blocked by security for the Italian embassy, so you can't catch a cab outside the hotel and cab drivers can't drop you off out front. 9) There is a school located right across the street that I believe is associated with the Italian embassy there. Every morning around 7:30 to 8am the area outside turns into a school yard with children yelling. It didn't bother me personally, but if you are a light sleeper this could be an issue. 10) I would say generally hotel staff seemed friendly. However, they do need additional training. The front desk had recommended a local historic hamam and even provided a brochure. The brochure gave the impression that it was high end but it turned out to be anything but. The women hamam attendants were old, rude and continually yelled at my wife in Turkish. The attendant rubbed my wife's neck so hard she experienced a large abrasive cut. When we brought this to the attention of the front desk at checkout, no apology was offered.
