After reading the reviews about this hamam on trip advisor (wish we had done so before my wife went!), it is rated extremely poorly. It doesn't seem like the hotel vets any of their recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: michaelandro
Reviews.Content: TomTom Suites was the perfect choice for our honeymoon trip to Istanbul. It has beautiful, modern and stylish interior. Very different than ottoman style represented by the rest. Hotel location is very good- quiet, but just a few steps from the middle of the action. Rooms are bautiful with marble bathrooms. Staff- very polite and helpfull. I would definietly go back again as it is one of the most beautiful small hotels in which we have ever had the pleasure of staying.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: TO_traveller69
Reviews.Content: Late writing this review, but I stayed here for 3 nights in August 2010. Absolutely loved the hotel. From the small touches of being taken to the rooftop bar/restaurant for a glass of wine while the concierge shows you the sights by map and from the hotels excellent view. Was upgraded to a suite on the top level which was fantastic. Helpful staff - the private guided tour they organize is a great option to see the main sights with a local guide. If we got back to Istanbul I will definitely be staying @ this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury in the European Quarter”
Reviews.Author: zanaida
Reviews.Content: After having stayed twice in the old part of Istanbul, we didn't know what to expect when coming to the Tomtom Suites. Tomtom is located on a quiet, sectioned off street walking distance from the young, shopping, food & bar filled European part of Istanbul. The hotel itself is pristine. We had an enormous room with an equally huge bathroom. Everything tastefully but sparsely decorated. The bed was a hit with different types of pillows to chose from and a mattress that meant I slept like a dream. The breakfast buffet was very similar to what we experienced throughout Turkey so nothing to report there (I did have one negative incident where I ordered a soft-boiled egg and it came out virtually raw - when I sent it back they told me I must have meant 'medium boiled'!). The views from the restaurant though are fantastic and the dinner food was divine.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: gariff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at TomTom on my first visit to Istanbul for five nights. I admit I prefer unique, higher end boutique hotels versus chains or the massive tourist hotels....and TomTom hits it out of the ballpark. Details matter here, and they are reflected in a superb staff. Rooms are impeccable and very comfortable -- with the busy traveller in mind. Breakfasts were tasty. (Ask for the Turkish eggs with peppers and tomatoes.) But it's the location that is ideal. Quiet street next to the Italian consulate -- so no traffic. And a five minute walk (albeit it up a steep hill) to the hubbub of Istanbul evenings. You won't be disappointed with TomTom. Perfect location for an Istanbul stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding in Every Respect”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJamesChicago
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Tomtom Suites. Last time I booked a junior suite but this time my partner and I had the executive suite. Similar to my last stay here, everything was outstanding. Amazing staff who are polite, professional, and helpful yet never overbearing. Beautiful rooms. Amazing location. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Recommend it most highly.

Reviews.Title: “The best you can get!!!!”
Reviews.Author: savvastzeve
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing stay!! Very warm welcome, very kind people, beautiful rooms very big with spacious bathroom, limited but very tasteful breakfast, great view from top floor where is the restaurant, very very clean and fine design of the building. I will definetely go back in Tomtom suites.

Reviews.Title: “So Hip and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bbbuckles
Reviews.Content: Tomtom Suites was a real winner. Loved the location, the room was magnificent, modern, spotless, quiet and huge. I gave the bathroom a perfect 10. Great TV with some real channels, not just news channels in English. It was so hip that they gave us iPads to read the newspapers on in the morning at breakfast. The staff was also helpful and nice. My one complaint....walked into the downstairs bar one evening and asked for a shot of vodka on the rocks---the charge was 32 TL--yikes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Jewel”
Reviews.Author: SangminOh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family (2 year old daughter and my wife) plus my parents, total about 7 nights. TomTom Suites is exceptional. All the staffs have been so polite and helpful all the time, foods were great. We are rarely impressed by hotels, but, this time - the hotel made our trip so much more memorable. The Turkish hospitality is none to second, at least at TomTom. There's independence street, about 5 mins of walk from the hotel up the hill - it was great to hang out there until midnight, filled with young crowd and lots of artists. So much energy is there. We went there every night - many good restaurants, shops, and bars, and desert places! There are two ways to go up the hill to independence street, and one is much shorter! However, at night, there's not much lighting, so not encouraged to walk although I found no trouble personally. Maybe taking a short walk during day time, and taking a longer route (with lighting) during night time is a good idea. To the old historic area, you can walk down hill about 5 mins, and there's tram, you can take it and cross the bridge easily and comeback same way. It was very easy. I actually stayed another 3 nights in old area, and kind of regretted my decision. The quality and service of the hotel over there, which was just about 30$ cheaper than TomTom was not to be compared in any positive way to TomTom. Hotel foods are not cheap, but I found quality there. At the time of my visit, they were offering some discount for hotel residents, and I ate about every two days, and was happy with it. Liquors are not cheap, but there's good view. Breakfast was excellent! All the waiters were extremely helpful and kind. The only concern was safety issue. It's at the top of the building, and my 2 year old wanted to go to the edge of the balcony where there were no shields - that kind of made me feel a bit concerned whenever I was there. For adults, this safety issue does not apply at all unless you're uncontrallably drunken :) This hotel is very calm. This is because it's about 5 min walk from busy streets, and it's across Italian consulate. It looks a bit separated from real world, but I found it very nice. Overall, TomTom has been great. After my Istanbul stay, I stayed in Santorini, Crete, and Athens for another 2 weeks, and always missed my stay in TomTom. I'm sure I'll make another visit to TomTom, and I'm recommending this place to all my friends and colleagues. The longer you stay, the longer you're likely to miss it - very good very luxurious, hard to beat for what you pay. My wife almost cried when she was leaving.... Only missing thing will be swimming pool. If you're very serious about it, that may be the only reason not to stay at TomTom. But, who would care too much about swimming pool in Istanbul so much?

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireWhisperer
Reviews.Content: 6 of us went to istanbul for the weekend. This hotel was lovely. Very modern, superb rooms, very quiet opposite the italian embassy so no passing traffic, great location, 5 minutes down the hill for the trams, great service from the staff ( especially the guys at breakfast). Good suggestions from the "guest manager" about what to do/ trips/ restaurants etc. Good choice of food for breakfast. Ate on our 1st night at thehotel's rooftop restaurant - beautiful view - food was well cooked - a modern twist on turkisk food - we all would have preferred a more "traditional" menu though. An excellent little boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Zen and Divine!”
Reviews.Author: luvgreathotels
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is to-die- for! A wonderful refuge from the stimulation of touring busy Istanbul This is a very beautiful and recently renovated building with wonderful art and fabulous rooms. The rooms are huge, modern and comfortable. The bathroom is five-star with marble throughout, a yummy shower and large jacuzzi tub. The beds are very comfortable. Great toiletries products are provided. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. There are fresh flowers elegantly displayed throughout this zen-like building. INternet is free. The breakfast is wonderful, varied and delicious. My only complaint is the over-priced dinner venue but this is a minor point. I would HIGHLY recommend this wonderful hotel and hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay away from the city hubbub”
Reviews.Author: Malden04
Reviews.Content: When you first arrive at TomTom Suites you might wonder where you are coming to as the area looks a little run down! But it is in a great location in a street with no passing traffic. Its so quiet. Access to the main sites is easy. Downhill, the tram is within a 5 minute walk and uphill, Iskatel Cadesi ( a buzzing main street with loads of shops and restaurants) and a 2 minute walk round the corner leads to some narrow streets full of atmosphere and restaurants This boutique hotel itself is a sea of tranquility with beautifully appointed rooms, a great breakfast and very helpful staff. Our only regret was that the Terrace bar wasn't open but as the weather was unseasonably inclement it wasn't a problem. We had a great time and would definitely recommend the TomTom Suites

Reviews.Title: “Luxe Hotel in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Michael/Steven
Reviews.Content: The Tomtom Suites is one of the most beautiful small hotels in which we have ever had the pleasure of staying. It is well situated near the pedestrian shopping street, Istiklal, so there are many, many options for restaurants and bars nearby. It is also extremely safe: because the Italian Consulate is across the street, the road to the hotel is guarded 24/7 by security personnel. But Istanbul seems to be a very safe city anyway. The hotel is extremely modern, with beautiful woodwork and art everywhere. All of the furniture in the rooms is handmade, the rugs are hand woven, and the bathrooms are gorgeous, with white-veined marble covering all the walls and floors. Even the toilet is beautiful, a piece of sculptural art by Philippe Starck. The rooms have a very luxe feeling about them, right down to the high thread-count sheets and oversized pillows. Given all of this luxury, this hotel felt like a real bargain. The front desk staff was very helpful with any questions we had and we were given a lovely introductory drink when we arrived as well. Nice touches all around. The breakfast on the fourth floor terrace is wonderful, with everything one could want (and more). The Turkish fruit and yogurt mixture was fantastic! And the view from that terrace was breathtaking - one could see all across Beyoglu and over to Sultanahmet with the towers and domes of Topkapi and the Blue Mosque distinct. Amazing. This is a great luxury hotel and if we had any gripes at all it would be the exorbitant cost of drinks on that gorgeous terrace. We had the most expensive gin and tonics of our lives! Still, we enjoyed our stay here immensely and would heartily recommend the Tomtom Suites to anyone visiting Istanbul. It is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but Needs Better Cleaning Services”
Reviews.Author: anfrankel
Reviews.Content: The Tomtom Suites is a beautiful small hotel in Beyoglu. The location is convenient and near enough to walk to Sultanhamet. The rooms are beautiful. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace is a highlight. The biggest issue is that the cleaning service needs to be upgraded. We had used bottles of shampoo from previous clients in our room. Bottled water which was on our bedside table when we arrived was not replaced when empty. Glasses were not replaced after use. This would be a topnotch place to stay if the cleaning services werebrought up to par with the rest of the iotel.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves more than 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Anicka10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled extensively through U.S., Europe and the Caribbean and have stayed in hotels ranging from very upscale to modest. We are very discriminating without being fussy. I have to say honestly that the level of service we experienced in this hotel was equal to my favorite chain of Four Seasons without the exorbitant prices. The hotel staff couldn't do enough for us. We stayed at Tomtom for 11 nights. It was such a pleasure to come back to this oasis after a tiring day of sightseeing and seeing everybody's welcoming smile. This hotel is elegant, yet cool and hip. Everything is ultra modern. Our immaculate hotel suite was beutifully decorated. The bed extremely comfortable. The bathroom stocked up with every thing you may need including fluffy Turkish towel robes. The neighborhood felt very safe as we came back late many times after taking a walk in Istiklal Caddesi. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Crazycat
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The location is great - just a short walk to the tram station which takes you to all the main tourist attractions quickly and cheaply. The hotel itself was fantastic - we stayed in a standard room which was great and for the money was exceptional value. The room was spotlessly clean, bed linen was of a high quality and the bathroom was spacious with more Molten Brown freebies that you could wish for! The staff however really made our stay - nothing was too much trouble, they gave great advice and were always very welcoming. The friendly waiting staff on the Roof Terrace were brilliant too and we regularly had dinner as well as breakfast which made a great start and end to the day. We have already recommended to all our friends and would not hesitate in booking again. We only wish there were TomTom Suites in other cities! Tip - for UK citizens you do need a Visa to enter the country which you can queue up for in the airport and costs Â£10 - you need this before joining the passport control queue. You can pay in Sterling, Euros or Turkish Lira. There was much confusion at the airport and loads of UK citizens were being sent back to get Visa's (including us!). Tip - pre-book airport transfers and print the location map out from the TomTom website (handy for cab rides too). The map was very useful as the pre-booked airport transfer driver didn't know where the hotel was. Allow an hour or so to get to the hotel - traffic going into Istanbul from the airport can be really heavy with long queues.

Reviews.Title: “Forget Four Seasons; THIS is your hotel”
Reviews.Author: LagunaWaterSign
Reviews.Content: We are a well-traveled and picky group who unanimously agreed that this hotel was a beautiful and service oriented oasis in the bustling city of Istanbul. While not right in the more touristy Sultanahmet area, it's a quick tram ride across the bridge. And the Taksim Square area is not to be missed for its shopping and night life. What a pleasant experience to arrive at the TomTom Suites after 16 hours of flying to stand under the rain shower head and use the Molton Brown products then wrap myself in one of their fluffy white towels. The staff seemed to anticipate our every need. Our senior suite rooms were very tastefully decorated with original art and were unbelievably spacious. Our only criticism is that their WiFi constantly dropped. This is a very fixable issue and one I hope they will resolve soon. Other than that, this property was the gold standard against which we compared subsequent hotels through the remainder of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: exdcguy
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews of the Tomtom are accurate. While it may be true that taxi drivers may have difficulty in finding the Tomtom, they had no trouble getting through the barriers at the entrance to the street. The barriers do retract. In addition, the location is perfect, if you want a quiet place to sleep. It is only a ten minute walk to the tram, which takes you to the old town. There are a number of restaurants within walking distance and it is safe to walk in the neighborhood at night.

Reviews.Title: “the best in price /quality”
Reviews.Author: PATRICKDEGROOTE
Reviews.Content: + very good breakfast,large and quiet rooms,very nice and friendly staff,great location,clean,great view from the terras, very good dinner,free wifi,taxipoint and public transport is nearby(150m) and cheap - wifi signal is poor :not always connection. this trip was my 11time in istanbul ,always a different hotel. this hotel was the very best of it ,the 12 time to istanbul will be in the same hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning stylish spacious comfort in Istanbul near Istiklal Cadessi”
Reviews.Author: Coorong
Reviews.Content: I arrived early in the morning to a gracious welcome at Tomtom Suites. This set the tone for a wonderful visit. The clerk apologised that my room was not available because they had been fully booked the previous night. This was before 7.30 AM! so no surprise there. I was shown to the terrace where I had coffee and fresh squeezed juice while looking at the amazing view across to the old city including the Suleymania mosque and Topkapi palace. My suite was enormous and beautifully furnished with a gorgeous marble bathroom. I loved the dust-free parquetry floors and the beautiful flowers in the public areas. The location was great and wonderfully peaceful. The hotel is just off the Istiklal Cadessi (pedestrian street). It's a steep walk up the hill- but not too far. The security guard at the street entrance helps the feeling of security. I had no hesitation walking around the hotel area alone and noticed a number of other single local women doing the same. The Tophane tram station was a 5 to 10 minute walk and provided easy access to the old city. It was crowded at peak times but much quicker than the cars alongside. I also caught the metro from the very decorative Sishane station I will certainly return to Istanbul and can't think of a better place to stay than Tomtom suites.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but bad location”
Reviews.Author: Monica88_10
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms with upto-date fixtures and staff is very helpful but the location is far from historic attractions, hard to find for taxi drivers (who tend to overcharge) and on a hill. Because of security barriers due to the Italian consulate on the same street, taxis leave you at the bottom of the hill and you have to walk up the hill which may not be agreeable for some guests. Walking to the nearest shopping area is an even steeper climb. Restaurant food is over-priced and not as good as Turkish restaurants outisde.

Reviews.Title: “TomTom Suites is beautifully modern hotel with excellent, warm service - the attention to detail makes it stand out!”
Reviews.Author: hameeda19
Reviews.Content: The TomTom Suites is a hidden gem of a hotel; the lobby, restaurant and rooms were all impeccable. The staff at the TomTom Suites was both professional and warm. Not only was the hotel wonderful, but it was in an ideal location, close to the tramway and the nightlife of Pera.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique beauty”
Reviews.Author: travel4you60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a 3 night stay at TomTom Suites. We celebrated our fist wedding anniversary and enjoyed 100% the stay a this lovely place. Comparing Tom Tom to other places in the top leage of boutique hotels, it certainly ranks among the top five (location, quality of the room/facilities, value). There is no pool or gym, so make sure to relax at a Hamam in town. The restaurant is also located on the 4th floor and terrace offers indeed a beautiful view over the harbour and the Golden Horn (see the TomTom internet site/gallery). I can duly recommend the restaurant for dinner (blend of Turkish and modern cuisine, fish and beef were delicious). Focus is on quality ingredients and less on choice. Only recommendation for TomTom: please dim the light on the terrace and add candles to the tables to make the place even more romantic. Thanks to the wonderful and enthusiastic team at TomTom - will return with great pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “it couldn't be any better”
Reviews.Author: LincolnRio
Reviews.Content: Staying at Tomtom was the best possible choice we could have made, everything was simply perfect: the location, the facilities, the staff, the quality of the food, the elegance and modern style of the furniture, the superb view of the terrace where we had breakfast as well as a wonderful dinner and a lovely evening. Many details made us feel at home, such as the Ipod dock in the rooms and the Ipads we could use free of charge during breakfast. Most of all, the friendliness of the staff, all of them extremely helpful. I'd highlight Chiara, who gave us many tips, especially telling us to go to Bagdah st., on the Asian side, a place great place that no books mentioned; and Ali, a wonderful guy, much more than a concierge, and a perfect host who did everything he could to make our stay as good as it gets. the proximity to Istklal street, and the tram make the location convenient for both day and night. Considering everything, including the fair rates cherged, I doubt there's a better choice in town.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant hotel for enjoying Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rousselshanghai
Reviews.Content: "Great hotel in a quite and perfect location for tourism in Istanbul. Vincinity of Taksim's metro and Tophane's tram makes every place in Istanbul easy to go to. The Hotel features a great accommodation in large, comfortable and beautiful rooms, quite and welcoming place. Staff is nice, effective and discrete. Last but not least, the restaurant at the top of the hotel is great and offers a delicious modern Ottoman cuisine."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful service, great location”
Reviews.Author: CaluBrazil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Tomtom suites in August when Istanbul was going through the worst heatwave in 130 years. We were impressed because unfortunately there was a glitch in the airconditioning for a couple of hours in our room on our first evening, and the staff at the hotel ran around madly until it was fixed and offered us a courtesy meal in their restaurant as compensation (which was delicious, and the view very pleasant). This caring service was repeated throughout our stay and all our requests were met with smiles and were promptly attended. The concierge made excellent suggestions for meals, both at fancy restaurants and simple ones. The room was wonderful- very light and airy, comfortable, large, and everything was in pristine order. The bathroom was fabulous and Molton Brown toiletries, thick towels, all sorts of thoughtful extras for men and women made bathing a real pleasure. There is a well stocked bar (though prices are steep) and a kettle in the room. The safe is huge. Breakfast is taken upstairs in the attractive terrace and was pretty good. We could not have been happier with our choice of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, but staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: Gulliver07
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautifully appointed with exquisite art and all the usual amenities one can need. Over-sized bathrooms, high ceilings, everything one could hope for. A true showcase of modern art and lots of space. As well, front staff were extremely helpful, providing maps and information on everything we asked. However... there were some problems with service staff. We could only book a standard room for the first of three nights but were told via e-mail (weeks earlier) that they will have a junior suite for us (at a higher rate of course). Well, it didn't quite work out that way. The cheaper standard room on the 3rd floor was actually nicer than the junior suite. Though the jr.suite is described as having a 'garden view' from the 3rd floor, we ended up on the first floor, looking at rows of barbed wire that belonged to the Italian consulate across the street. Not what we had expected from a superior category. In fairness, upon checkout they did adjust the invoice and we were not charged the additional cost of the 'suite' (though we would have much preferred if they had honored the confirmation of our original booking and provided us with the room we were told we will get). The view from the small terrace restaurant is fabulous. Drinks and food are expensive, but reasonably good. Make sure to order the 'meze' for a starter. Menus is quite limited. Serving staff are unsure about what they are doing and would benefit from additional training. Maybe it's a cultural thing, but we didn't see anyone smiling. They seemed quite tense. (Except one young server at breakfast who had a sense of humor). There are better restaurants for the money, but it's convenient to dine in after a day of sightseeing. Airport transfer is included, but there was a glitch. The bell-man placed our luggage in a taxi he had called and we drove off, the meter running. After a few minutes I asked the driver why the meter was on and though he did not speak English we gathered there was no complimentary fare. I asked him to drive us back to the hotel where the designated van was waiting for us, not knowing we had left via taxi. Just another example of the staff not quite knowing what is going in. If they manage to clean up their act, I would certainly stay there again, as it is a truly beautiful small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SERIOUSLY BRILLIANT - PROFESSIONAL”
Reviews.Author: Bill255060
Reviews.Content: Right from it's location being central Istaubnl right throuh to the exterior and interior of the hotel I fell in love with it. The staff were very courteous and cheery. My room was a standard room but let me assure you it was 5*. I couldnt fault anything, they really apid attention to fine details which made me love this place. THE BEDS ARE AMAZING!! I would love to attend this hotel again! Thanks guys!! Tesekurler

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Kiel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the tail end of our trip to Turkey and this hotel really blew us away. Any concerns about the location are unfounded. It is in the very trendy Beyoglu neighborhood, very close to the tram station to the major tourist sites. As a matter of fact, this was a much needed retreat from the somewhat chaotic Sultanahmet district of Istanbul. I highly recommend TomTom, what a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Quiet Boutique Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mOmwteens9
Reviews.Content: Just steps from the main pedestrian street Istiklal Caddesi, on a hill in Beyoglu overlooking the Bosphorus, this is your quiet retreat after an active day in noisy, intense Istanbul. This ultra modern small hotel has one of the best restaurants in the city, with unparalleled views. The staff is polite, accommodating and everyone speaks a variety of languages. You can book a tour, get your laundry done, reserve a table at a local restaurant-the staff makes everything easy. Many Istanbul attractions are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal voor sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: TheoSchroijen
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated near tramway (10 minutes walk) and trendy shops and restaurants (5 minutes walk). Superb view from the roof-terrace: Bosporus, Golden Horn harbour, and all the important mosques in the old city. Excellent rooms and service. Great value for money.!

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind - stay here”
Reviews.Author: W9_Gooner
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel enough, I have never written a review of a hotel but our stay here was so good I have been compelled to write one for the first time as they really deserve the recognition. The rooms, service, terrace bar and staff are all excellent. Having read the one review that is not excellent or very good I am very surprised that anyone could not have loved this hotel. Definite highlights are the terrace bar and the rooms. The terrace bar has spectacular views of Sultanahmet, the aghia sophia, blue mosque, etc. I would recommend having a drink during the call to prayer as this is very atmospheric and not to be missed. The staff even kept the bar open for us when we wanted to relax for a couple of drinks late at night at the end of an evening. As detailed in some of the other reviews the rooms are massive (our suite was the size of an apartment and had a separate sitting area with sofa) with all the mod-cons you could possibly want, rain-head showers, high-end fixtures, fittings, linen, satelite tv, i-pod docks, etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they booked several restaurants for us and recommended activities. Also they have a taxi company that they use and book for the guests which removes the normal bartering/blagging process whenever you hail a cab on the street. Dogan, the manager, and his staff went out of their way during our stay to make sure we were well looked after and they are all very helpful and personable. Overall, excellent hotel, the location is very quiet yet 5 mins walk from one of the main streets in Istanbul (Istiklar) with lovely rooms, nice staff and a beautiful bar. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Tom Tom Suites - Brilliant Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aziffel
Reviews.Content: From the fantastic architecture and food to the staff this Hotel is a true find.No expense has been spared in making this place very special.It is truly exquisite.The staff were exceptional.We stayed 6 nights ( 4 at beginning of our Turkey trip) and 2 at the end .We spoiled ourselves on the last 2 nights by taking the penthouse. The decor , views and the magical views over the city topped off a fabulous 3 week trip to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in the old Pera”
Reviews.Author: SLusi
Reviews.Content: Elegantly furnished, clean, big rooms with A/C, terrace with astonishing view, rich breakfast, excellent service, polite members of stuff, very close to the center of the city (accessible by tram or on foot), safe area, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: neoncih
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for a romantic weekend at a suit with a beautiful terrace.View from terrace was fabulous ,the room was huge and has an elegant luxury ,staff ,breakfast,location,architecture everything was 5 out of 5 stars.Number one choice for Istanbul stays,highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel with wonderful rooms and incredible views from the superb rooftop restaurant / bar”
Reviews.Author: reparkska
Reviews.Content: A really wonderful hotel in a superb location on a traffic free road. It was so peaceful it was easy to forget that we were in the middle of one of the world's busiest cities. The staff were deligthful and couldn't do enough to help. The hotel is in a converted monastary which has been sympathetically refurbished, the artwork depicting istanbul brings a touch of colour - especially in the lift shaft. Our room was enormous and well appointed with a luxurious large bathroom - and yes, a jacuzzi bath. The rooftop restaurant and bar was a perfect way to relax at the end of the day and must have some of the best views in Istanbul over the Bosphorous and the Golden Horn. The food was excellent, modern turkish using french cooking techniques and local produce. Overall I can't wait to go back and I can't recommend the place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved staying there”
Reviews.Author: tamer316
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very friendly and helpful staff, I absolutely loved the suite and the Jaccuzzi was great for relaxing after a long day of walking around hilly Istanbul! The hotel location was very convenient as it's within walking distance of Istiklal street (the main shopping area) and there's a close tramway to take you into all the main attractions Istanbul has to offer. The terrace restaurant/bar offers an amazing view of Istanbul and was nice to wake up to for breakfast, although the breakfast buffet selection was a bit limited. The guest relations manager was kind enough to book a table at Reina on a Saturday night for us, which was a little overpriced but well worth it as the food was great and the club atmosphere later was amazing. Overall I was very happy with my stay there and would definitely recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LG1171
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Tom Tom in a Junior Suite. The decor is modern and tasteful. Our suite was very spacious and had the MOST comfortable bed. Seriously! It was so hard not to take naps. Breakfast is served outdoors on the top floor with a nice view. The front desk was also very friendly and extremely helpful with everything. It is located in a convenient location... very close to istikal cadessi and also centrally located between the old city and other areas you may want to visit. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Gem”
Reviews.Author: J-Class
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find fault with the TomTom Suites in Istanbul, which does what a boutique hotel should do extremely well. Our room (a Senior Suite) was huge, decorated in comfortable modern style, with a great marble bathroom to boot. Staff are friendly and competent, the terrace bar has a charming Bosphorus view, and breakfast is good (we didn't dine at the hotel). The Four Seaons and Ciragan Kempinski can obviously beat the TomTom for facilities and (for conventional types) location, but for me this a great litle hotel. Issues - all minor: hard to find and unknown by taxi drivers (the hotel should provide direction cards); not crazy about the modern Turkish art in our rooms, but not a huge problem; and it took us until the second night to figure out that the shutters outside the windows could be closed to eliminate light pollution. We'll be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: TACLA
Reviews.Content: This was just the perfect choice for a first time in Istanbul. Best location, safe, easily accessible, right in front of the Italian Consulate, in a closed and 24/7 guarded street. The rooms are quite spacious, new, well maintained with everything that is needed. Wifi, iPhone/iPod connection, modern furniture. The bathrooms are GREAT!!!!! The staff was EXTREMELY helpful, from booking all restaurant reservations in advance, to suggesting yours and places to visit. They not only call taxis for you but also place you inside and explain to the drivers where to take you! They work hard to please you in every possible way!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern, Chic, Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jskla
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. It's across from the Italian consulate in a private guarded street. The minute we walked in, we knew we were staying at an ultra luxurious place! We were happily greeted by the front desk, and after our check-in, we were ushered to the Terrace Bar where we received a welcome drink! When we entered our Senior Suite room, it was heavenly! The couch looked (and was) super comfy and inviting. They had a separate TV and office area. The bathroom was floor to ceiling marbles, with a beautiful jacuzzi tub for two, and double vanities. Everything was presented perfectly! We immediately wanted to jump into the bed and relax, but since we had just arrived in Istanbul, we headed back out! On the first day in Istanbul, it was raining and we forgot to pack an umbrella, but Tomtom Suites provided umbrellas for everyone! It was perfect!! During the rest of our stay in Istanbul, the weather was perfect, especially for an afternoon cocktail on the Terrace Bar. The Bar had a beautiful view of the Old Sultanahmet District, especially of Hagia Sophia, the New Mosque, and the Blue Mosque. The hotel is perfectly situated as it is down the street from Istiklal Street in the New District of Istanbul. Istiklal Street is where all the trendy Turkish people hang out and shop! We were also down the street from the public lightrail and subway stops. The hotel concierge was also quite helpful in recommending restaurants, places to visit and to help make reservations for us! We would highly recommend Tomtom Suites to everyone and would definitely stay there again when we visit Istanbul in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Derek_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Jun 10. Totally exceeded expectations. Loved the spacious rooms and very modern refit of a classic building. Really comfortable beds. Staff were very attentive and friendly. I would not normally post a review but this stay and this hotel was exceptional. Only negative is the price of drinks in the terrace bar which are more than NY or London. But the view goes some way to compensate. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tra73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent. The staff is very warm and friendly and the service is impeccable. The rooms are very spacious, clean and comfortable. The view of the terrace is amazing. The location is very central. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “really good choice”
Reviews.Author: MOLLYBolton
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this small hotel from the 15 - 19th May, and we really enjoyed it. The rooms were lovely, large baths, nice toiletries, roof top bar has nice views.lots of extra's. would recommend this hotel to any one. I feel you would have to be really fussy to find any probems with this hotel or the staff. When we read the reviews no one mentioned getting there from the airport apart from using taxi. We used the metro from the airport. Red line to Zeytinburnu and then dark blue line to Tophane, cross the road and walk up the hill, dead easy only 3 TL each and no hassles.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO COME BACK TO”
Reviews.Author: sambucada
Reviews.Content: A very warm welcome from the reception staff,with a welcome glass of wine on the terrace.The suite was extremely welll appointed and in beautiful condition. The jacuzzi bath was a welcome draw at the end of a busy day sight seeing.The shower was excellent to.I found the bed to be a bit on the hard side. The breakfast on the terrace was excellent,with extremely good choice,they cooked eggs to order. Room 17 had the view of the buildings air conditioning units,this would be a problem if a view is important to you. A excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves a sixth star”
Reviews.Author: 28A
Reviews.Content: Everything you read on Tripadvisor about the Tomtom Suites is true..but now there'a an added attraction. The week I was there (early May) a talented new chef- Uryan Dogmus -joined the team.. If he hasn't been lured away by a major gourmet restaurant by the time you stay, sample the 'Turkish breakfast' - and be sure to give dinner a try. The menu is small but dishes are prepared with love. One additional comment to add to the general praise for the staff..In five days I never once heard the robotic reply 'no problem'.. Each request was met with a sincere response - usually -'Of course!'

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Stay Anywhere Else In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HayKay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 10 nights thanks to another traveller's passing comment on Trip Advisor. The rooms are gorgeously sleek- clean, modern, spacious,comfortable and quiet with a marble bathroom and wonderful soaps and toilettries. The room safe is designed large enough to hold a laptop. However, I couldn't pick up WIFI but that may have been just my limited technical skills although I have succeeded at other hotels. A computer is available in library room next to lobby for free. Service and staff are unbelievably good. Restaurant/bar on rooftop terrace has a top-notch young chef for dinner. Breakfast is great. View of Istanbul- the old, the modern, the vegetation, the Bosphorous and the Asian shore is to die for. I will miss it for the rest of my life. Hotel is located in the modern part of Istanbul (Beyoglu) and only about a 10 minute walk (uphill as usual in Istanbul) from the main street which is a must see- Istiklal Caddesi (cafÃ©s, restaurants, shops, bars, nightclubs and an old tram that runs up and down the street). Hotel is only a 10 minute taxi ride (at $10) from Sultanahmet or can hop on subway. Much safer than staying in Sultanahmet as far as I'm concerned. The beautiful and quiet Italian Consulate is right across the street and consequently access to the street is limited by 24 hour security guards who control street barriers. It is a small boutique hotel so no tour groups and reservations well in advance a good idea. It's fairly new and on a small street so taxi drivers (who only speak Turkish) don't know it but the hotel provides a business card with the hotel's address and a map of the hotel's location on the other side so taxi drivers never had a problem finding it. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. For us, this hotel made our vacation in the Istanbul part of our stay in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at TomTom”
Reviews.Author: jmfangio
Reviews.Content: My wife, mother and I really enjoyed our recent stay at TomTom. We always prefer smaller boutique places that are well designed and in actual neighborhoods vs. larger impersonal luxury hotels. TomTom didn't dissapoint! As previously mentioned, beautifully designed and furnished rooms, the best toiletries, etc. The roof deck is very nice with a great view. The location is amazing, in-between everywhere that you want to go but far enough away from the touristy madness. I'd argue it's one of the best situated hotels in Istanbul. As mentioned, it's a very steep but quick walk up to the main street of Isklal. However, this can be challenging if you have any mobility issues. In general, the area is rather hilly but so is most of Istanbul. In the other direction, you can walk up into a neighborhood renowned for antiques and nice cafes or down to the tram that takes you to the main tourist attractions or the road to get to Ortokoy or Bebek. At no point does it feel like you are in the "tourist district" but you never feel unwelcome or out of place. As for noise, we found the building itself to be quiet and well insulated. You didn't hear noise from the rooms around you and minimal noise from the room above. Nowhere near as bad as what an earlier reviewer described. The only real noise to speak of does come from the kids in the morning and the afternoon who walk on the dead-end road to and from school. Other than this, and some kids playing soccer on occasion, the street outside of the hotel is pretty quiet Breakfast in the morning is great. Freshly baked pastries (done at the hotel) and fruit, cheeses and meats, served by extremely friendly staff. Fuat in particular is a delight to interact with and was extremely helpful. The staff overall is very friendly and accommodating. Everyone at the front desk regardless of time of day did whatever they could to make sure we were receiving the best service possible. There are however a few things that need improvement to make the hotel even better. -While breakfast is excellent, we were less than impressed with dinner. To the point that we ate there once and did not choose to repeat the experience. The service was good but the quality of the food and the cooking was pretty bad esp. considering the prices of the food vs. what can be had in the neighborhood for much less. We are admitted foodies, but we didn't hold the hotel restaurant up to lofty expectations. This needs to be addressed. -While the staff is very friendly and eager to help, the hotel would benefit from a dedicated concierge or someone who really knows about the various restaurants around the city. With a hotel of this caliber, we expected them to be more informed about different places and to let us know how traffic can affect getting there, etc. If you didn't ask them these kinds of questions, it didn't occur to them to tell you. -Lastly, with the windows closed in the room there is zero airflow without having the heat on and it's extremely dry. I understand them not wanting to run the AC unless the temperature warrants, but there should be a way to circulate air without opening the windows in the spring (see my earlier comment about noise from school kids in the morning). In conclusion, we wouldn't hesitate to recommend TomTom to friends and hope to stay there again the next time we are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I expected much before arriving and received more”
Reviews.Author: summerblue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the TomTom Suites for 5 nights in April. I was traveling with a friend and we booked two separate rooms. We were coming off a 12-night cruise and, after sharing a claustrophobic cabin, when I arrived at the TomTom Suites I thought I had died and gone to heaven. The bath roooms are spacious and have a large, jetted tub, the bed is a King, the rooms have a large, flat screen TV and DVD player (the hotel has a DVD library) and the decor and art work is pleasing. The first night we arrived we were treated to a glass of wine by Alli, the Guest Relations Manager, and saw for the first time the beautiful view of Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque from the roof top bar and restaurant of the hotel. I always get out there and eat the local food and rarely take more than one evening meal in a hotel while I visit, but my friend and I ate at the restaurant on the top floor 3 nights of the 5 nights we stayed. I don't know what happened! We felt comfortable, enjoyed the staff and the view, and the food was good, so after a day of touring sites and being exhausted, it was one place were we just wanted to stay put. The breakfast in the morning was very nice and the tour company that the hotel recommends was very good. We did two private tours with this company (can't spell the name but it's the main one the hotel uses) and we were very happy with both tours. Suzanne was our guide and we can highly recommend her if you choose to ask for her. The location of the hotel is unique in that it is by the Italian Embassy and Russian Embassy so there is a guard at the top of the street and the street itself is quiet. This is a real bonus as Istanbul can be noisy and in this location it was like the craziness was just up the street buy not on our street. I liked Istanbul and wished I had more time. I generally pick a different hotel the second time around but in this case I would want to go back to my "home" in Istanbul again because that is how I felt while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel experience, a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: 12FootDavis
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was a big trip for us. Coming from western Canada and travelling 18 hours by plane, we wanted a hotel with good service, nice amenities, comfortable bed and bath, and that was near to the action of Instanbul. We stumbled across TomTom suites online, and took a chance with it...and are we ever happy we did! Although the map to the hotel confused all taxi drivers (I learned that saying Galatasaray would get you close), when we found it we were blown away. Fine old wood floors, marble staircase, excellent fit and finish, spotlessly clean everywhere...and this was only on the way to the room. Once in the room, we entered our large L shaped junior suite. Beautiful! Three large double windows that opened onto a quiet residential/private street facing the Italian consulate. Beautiful king sized bed with top quality bedding. 12 foot ceilings with crown moulding, handsome artwork, quality wood furniture and flat screen TV/DVD/Sat. How could they top it? Upon entering the floor to ceiling marble clad HUGE bathroom...I found out. Top quality fixtures, double sink, rainstorm shower head, double soaker jacuzzi tub, fine soaps and shampoos, etc. Did I mention that this was the JUNIOR SUITE? Complimentary welcome drink served on the Terrace bar roof was the next suprise...a STUNNING view of the Bosphorous/Golden horn with the Aya Sophia/Blue Mosque/Topaki Palace right there! The breakfast served from 7-1030 was spectacular. Fresh eggs on demand, squeezed OJ, choice of coffee, fresh pasteries, warm breads, olives, salad, fruits, cheeses, meats, etc. It was excellent everyday. Dinner in the restaurant was equally as good. The food is fresh and tasty, reasonably priced, and different enough from the typical Turkish meals in Beyoglu to make it a welcome treat. Nice wine list as well! The location was as good as it gets. A 5 minute walk (uphill) to Istiklal street and the endless shops, bars, and restaurants. A 5 minute walk (downhill) gets you to the train station that transports you to Sultanahmet and the Grand Bazaar/Blue Mosque in 15 minutes. Galata tower, Galatasaray Hamam, Taksim Square are all within walking distance. But when you are done with the crowds, your return to the oasis that is the TomTom Suites for a mid-afternoon siesta is one of the special pleasures that is so nice to find on a vacation. The staff was polite, multi-lingual, efficient and friendly. We really enjoyed our visits with them all and their warm smiles and thoughtful advice were welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay, brilliant staff, amazing room and view”
Reviews.Author: fantravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in this very beautiful hotel and Tomtom suites totally fulfilled our expectations. We wanted a quiet location in Istanbul and this hotel is more than perfect. Located near busy Istiklal street for shopping and restaurants, with easy reach to the tramway stop going to Sultanahmet in 5 minutes. The hotel is surrounded by embassies (Itally, Russia, France) and is very safe. We also loved the mixing contrast with the beautiful, lively popular life in the surrounding the area. It is not dirty neither rundown, it is just life as we lost in many hygienist western cities... During the day, you just hear for very few minutes children going to school and playing. This is absolutely not noise, just manifestation of life. Tomtom suites is very QUIET and it is really a peaceful, relaxing hotel where you can pamper and sooth yourself from hectic Istanbul activities. We were in executive suite and it is really an AMAZING suite : very large, king size comfy bed, 2 big flat TVs, large marble bathroom with big jacuzzi bathtub, living room with kitchenette, lots of stowage. Top of the top is the terrace, as big as the suite, with magnificent views on the Bosphorus and Sultanahamet. We loved to go early in Sultanahmet to visit turistic places than coming back at noon at the hotel to have sunbathing on the terrace and then going out again for shopping and eating + night life. We particularly loved the design of the hotel : contemporary beautiful and chic wooden furniture, beige fabrics, wooden and marble floors. It is has no flashy nor kitsch furniture you could find in many bad design hotels. Very feng shui and chic atmosphere. Staff is brilliant : very serviceable, professional staff, never intrusive. Thanks to Ali Dogan and his assistant working in the morning, a wonderful and very helpful woman. Breakfast is very good. Terrace bar-restaurant has nice atmosphere and beathtaking views. The only minus is the random turndown service. For this category of hotel we could expect a regular turndown service with bottles of water each night. Internet connection is also very slow. Tomtom suites is a top-notch hotel, one of the best in Istanbul. We'll definitely go back for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a 4 day getway”
Reviews.Author: corinneanne
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of the Tripadvisor.com reviews and it turns out they were all true. The hotel is wonderfully located, though the first night coming late from the airport we were a little worried as its nestled right in the middle of the old neighborhood of Beyoglu. The Rooms: Very large, very well appointed, very clean with lots of extra little details -- very full minibar, provided with the choice of local wines (we didn't but it was nice to see), beautiful carpets and lots of space. The hotel is a renovated convent so the bones of the place are great, the owner redid it in a modern style, which can sometimes mean poor details and bad construction, but not in this case. The whole place is beautifully renovated. Also I think the artwork is original and mostly of turkish artists, its very nice. Beds were incredibly comfortable with big pillows. Our bathroom had both a HUGE bathtup and a shower, with a very wide selection of soaps. When was the last time you stayed at hotel and you could choose between 3 different types of soap which are rotated daily so you have 3 different choices every day? Internet connection is a little slow at first but I think thats more a function of the Turkish states control on communication than the hotel's fault (it was interesting to see which sites were blocked or not). We had a room on the 3 floor overlooking the Italian consulates residency and the golden horn. The hotel doesn' t have what I imagine are the amazing views of the Bosphorus of the hotels on the water, but it doesn't need them either. The staff was beyond courteous. they were charming. The breakfast is delicious and a real spread and the staff was very helpful in the morning with our planning for the day. I would not only go back to this hotel, but recommend it (already have) heartily to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location, perfect rooms and super staff!”
Reviews.Author: thetraveljudge
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with my wife. Unfortunately the deluxe room type (their standard room) I had booked was full for the first night so they offered us the executive suite (200m2 including terrace with fantastic view). I was afraid that the deluxe room would be a dissapointment afterwards but the contrary was true. I have stayed in many 5* luxury hotels and in many of them this would one of their higher end rooms. The service is really great and very personal. The location is very central: shopping street around the corner and tourist sight is about 20 min walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: hazie1000
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and the staff very helpful (as everyone has mentioned). I really appreciated the late and tastey breakfasts at the weekend after partying in Istanbul. Only minor gripe was the bed wasnt too comfortable. It looked fantastic so couldnt work out why this was....made long lie ins a bit tricky. However overall I'd definitely recommend this place as a quiet street (noise seems to be an issue in the city), great service, lovely looking rooms and good location.

Reviews.Title: “I can't fault this hotel its world class!”
Reviews.Author: britonbizz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quietly situated opposite the Italian Consulate.Even the sign is discreet. Istanbul has a lot of goood hotels. For the price this one is outstanding. The staff are attentive and well mannered, the rooms are modern and well furnished. The food was well prepared and presented. The view from the upstaires terrace is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel, amazing room, staff, service etc.”
Reviews.Author: Tiego
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel we ever been to. The people there were the nicest you could hope (special thanks to Dogan who makes our stay even better with his pieces of advice and recommandations). The area is really quiet (in front of the Italian consulate) but few minutes from the tranway station that will bring you to the historical part of the city and few minutes walk from Istiklal street. The room had a great view on the city and the bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “5stars Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: elisemkII
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a five nights stay. The Hotel is the best that you can find. I was there with my family (two child two and four years old) and all the staff was great. The room are large and very well furnish with a big plasma tv. The Bathroom is large to with an oversized jacuzzi and a large shower too... the bathroom is large as a standard room in london :-) A terrace restaurant with a fabulous view of the Bosforo and an high grade couisine is the icing on the cake. The location is strategic and you can quickly reach a lot of point of interest in Istanbul. High recomended.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a great city”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: A boutique hotel where, for once, style does not come before substance. Central location, superbly renovated old palace, huge and well designed modern rooms (I had a senior suite) with high ceilings and large bathrooms in hammam-like white-and-grey marble. The most unusual thing about the hotel is the lack of noise, since the street is closed to traffic because of the Italian consulate. Breakfast is very good and is served in a room + terrace with a view of the Bosphorus, Topkapi and Haghia Sophia. I had dinner in the restaurant once, and it was fine, although there are many good places serving authentic Turkish cuisine nearby. The only facility I missed was a fitness room, but the hotel can arrange a day pass at a club not too far away. Free use of the computer, including Internet. Very kind and attentive service, 5 stars in a modern way.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Dada73
Reviews.Content: I stayed there only for 3 nights in a de luxe room that was excellent in terms of these small things you need when you travel. Huge and clean bathroom with jacuzzi fully equipped with bath, cosmetics and personal hygiene sets, decent minibar, big and comfortable bed. Not much space in the closet though. If you are there, do not miss breakfast on the top floor with a magnificent bay view. Very cosy, quiet and elegant boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth to visit it”
Reviews.Author: VassilisV
Reviews.Content: We had been at Istanbul for business purposes and used to stay at the well-known brands at Taxim. This time the trip was for leisure and we were looking for a charming, cozy, friendly, clean, staff friendly boutique hotel. So, THIS IS TomTom suites and we consider ourselves very lucky to stay there. Due to the Italian embassy its socak is not crowded and safe 24/7. Breakfast variety was very satisfactory, view from terrace wonderful, staff very friendly, very quiet and clean. If you are looking for a hotel with ID, we strongly recommend it. Be aware that Istiklal street is only 5 minute walking, but uphill.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Boxboy
Reviews.Content: We too, chose Tom Tom because of this site. We were going to stay at a Starwood Hotel - probably Le Meridien as I'm a member, but were quite taken with the feedback provided here. Apart from the style of the hotel which appealed from the website, the hotel is extremely central, which in a city like Istanbul, is very important. Relaxing on the roof terrace with a glass of wine overlooking the Bospherous (the pictures don't lie) at the end of a gruelling day site-seeing was perfect. I've been waxling lyrical about the whole trip since we got but but do make special mention of Tom Tom. Since coming back we've heard from people, we were unaware of before we left, that have apartments in Istanbul which are now being offered on our next, inevitable, trip. In all seriousness we will decline as there are few places I've felt quite so at home in - the decore being similar to what we have at home. I have to make special mention regarding the staff. Rarely have I come across sweeter, more friendly and deferential people - always on hand to assist or freshen my glass - a real winner for me. Right up to the receptionist waving at us as we drove away, we felt they couldn't do enough for us. I can't recommend Tom Tom enough. I wish them all the best and very much look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “A complete winner - elegant, clean, warm and inviting”
Reviews.Author: Digimom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on other recommendations on this site. With consistently outstanding comments, we felt very confident in the quality of the hotel. Visiting their website, we learned that the rates were very attractive compared to other big-name hotels with similar ratings. We ended up in a Senior Suite that was MASSIVE with absolutely beautiful antique oak floors in a chevron pattern - really a work of art in their own right. Our room was light and airy with 14 foot ceilings and three large picture windows. The room was decorated simply but very elegantly and featured handwoven rugs and handmade local pottery and original contemporary oil paintings of Istanbul sites. Our large and luxurious carrera marble bathroom had heated floors and a separate (large) rainhead shower and 6 foot jetted tub. Double sinks and large mirrors finished the room. Fixtures were Hans Grohe and Duravit. We had our choice of 4 types of soap (Olive Oil, Thyme, Daphne, Cinnamon) and a selection of pillow choices. The bathroom was stocked with 2 shaving kits, a loufah mitt, pumice stone, 2 dental kits and Molton Brown lotion, shampoo, conditioner, bath gel and SeaMoss stress relieving hydrosoak (bath salts). Other small items included shower cap, cotton balls, cotton buds. The bathroom also featured large white turkish towels, heavy white robes, a 1200 watt hairdryer and lighted makeup mirror. In the hallway, we had an oversized closet with a safe, stocked minibar, complimentary coffee setups and bottled water. The room included umbrellas (not needed), shoe horn and cloth laundry bags. We enjoyed a complimentary breakfast with Salmon, fresh cheeses, homemade breads, fruit, jam and cereals. The library had many terrific books about Istanbul, Turkey and we especially enjoyed the history books that helped educate us on the environs. What we most enjoyed about this hotel was the staffs' warm welcome and quest to provide support for every need. They were charming, knowledgable and fun to be with. In terms of location, it is very close to the metro stop (by walking down the hill) and we never had any trouble getting a cab within about 5 minutes of calling one. The climb back to the hotel (uphill) is not for everyone. I recommend this for moderately fit couples who want luxury but also the opportunity to be in a neighborhood that is quiet, safe and real. Be sure to print out the map of the hotel from the hotel website as many of the taxi drivers did not know where it is (because it is small and new). Tell them it is next to the Italian Consulate. Absolutely would recommend this to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Base for a City Break in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: wimble21
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get a room at this hotel when making a last minute booking. This is a gorgeous boutique hotel. We were greeted at a very lovely and relaxed reception area with a very nice glass of wine. The ambience actually made checking into a hotel an experience rather than a chore. The rooms are luxurious in a contemporary style and all is set up to enjoy a little indulgence. The staff at this hotel are incredibly friendly and helpful, without being overbearing. There is a sense that great pride is taken in how this hotel is run. It is such a tranquil space to return to after a busy day exploring the hustle and bustle of Istabul. It is also very conveniently located for all the major sights. We really loved the tasty breakfast consisting of fresh fruit salad, freshly squeezed orange juice, very strong Turkish Coffee, cheeses, tomatoes, cucumber and breads. Travellers who need to consider ease of mobility, may need to be aware of the sharp incline on some of the streets surrounding this hotel, albeit over a very short distance.
